User Summary

The second Indiana Jones videogame ever and the first not adapted from a movie, Indiana Jones and the Lost Kingdom features a blend of puzzles and action.

89593.name: Apache Raid
89593.description:
Game box

The homestead is under attack by hostile redskins. While some gallop around to draw your fire others sneak up for the kill. Once these characters are in the cabin scalps will be lifted! All good family fun really. Your party is SIX strong. Your scalp will be the last to be lifted!

Score points for riders and scalpers.

89594.name: Face Ache
89594.description:
Within the time limit, recreate the funny faces shown on screen.

Game box

Roll up, roll up come and see the funny faces. Weird ones, ugly ones all from very strange places. "Hey mum, look at this, looks like dad when he hasn't shaved." "Good grief", remarks dad, "there's Auntie Maud. And isn't that your mother when she trod on the cat?" "Careful dear, I could soon point you out after one of your office parties."

Great for the family, monstrously funny. A Chamber of Horrors to laugh at. Be sure to watch in the safety of your living room. See these 'munsters' or play the game to try and remember and recreate them. But do not go to your local police station and give a description, they just will not believe you.

89595.name: The Thinker
89595.description:
Game box

The Thinker is a sliding block puzzle that is guaranteed to give you weeks of absolute hell. (Even the programmer can't solve it without his 'crib sheet'!) If you value your sanity, don't buy this game. It makes the Rubic Cube look simple.

The object of the game is to remove the large red block through the hole at the bottom of the puzzle. This is achieved by moving the blocks into spaces left by the movement of other blocks. On skill leves 2-5, if you take too long to make your move, the computer will move a block of its choice. (This will always be against the best interest of the player.) The higher the skill level, the less time you have to make your move. If you make an illegal move, the computer will warn you. Do it too often and you are in for a nasty surprise. When the frustration gets too great, send a SAE stating where and when
you bought the game and we will send you the solution. But please don't ask unless you have been trying for at least a month!

89596.name: Jackle & Wide
89596.description:
Game box

At last after years of research Dr Jackle has finally acquired the formula for the transforming potion. Without knowing how long the transformation process will last or even if it is possible to reverse the effects, he mixes the elements together and watches, transfixed, as the liquid bubbles and foams in the glass. This is the moment he has been waiting for.
Locking and bolting the doors to his laboratory, Dr Jackle raises the glass and swallows the potion...

The transformation is a success, the potion actually works, but if Dr Jackle could possibly have known beforehand that he would assume the personality and characteristics of Mr Wide he would have never taken it. Mr Wide is a completely evil man, the exact opposite in every respect of Dr Jackle - the transformation provess must be reversed, but how?

In his eagerness to experiment with the potion Dr Jackle neglected to prepare an antidote, but there is one person who might just be able to help him. Dr Piqued his sworn enemy and rival created the formula, so he may have an antidote. The problem is finding it. Dr Piqued's secret laboratory lies below ground, hidden in a maze of sewers below Hyde Park. The antidote must be kept there, but getting to it is no easy
matter.

The game is comprised of 2 sections, above ground in Hyde Park and below ground in the old converted sewers Dr Piqued uses as a hideout and secret laboratory.

Part 1 - The Park
Your progress through the park depends on how good you are at solving the various puzzles which crop up along the way. You must solve these in order to progress and there are a few hints scattered around. Just to give an idea of what you're likely to come up against, one task you will be set is to gain entrance to the quarry. To do this you need to go into one of the underground labyrinths, to do this you need to cut a path to it, and to cut a path you need... got the picture? Most of the objects you will come across do have a ause and you are
able to Take, Drop and List these.

Part 2 - In the Underground Labyrinth
There are nine sewers for you to get lost in before you reach the hideout containing the all important antidote - and as if that wasn't bad enough the sewers abound with all sorts of nasty creatures who don't take too kindly to strangers nosing around. They will do their level best to prevent you from reaching the antidote - so keep a look out. If you do happen to come into contact with any of them your energy level will decrease. A word of warning, try not to let it get too low! Should you decide you want to leave a particular labyrinth,
you will find yourself back in the park and you will not be able to re-enter that particular labyrinth.

89597.name: Space Walk
89597.description:
Game box

You are an astronaut in command of a space shuttle. From your base on the moon you keep watch for stray satellites and try to retrieve them. Battle your way across the lunar surface then use your jet-pack to thrust up to the satellite. Rendezvous with the satellite before it crashes into the lunar moonscape - then carry it back to your launch pad, where your space shuttle is stationed. Avoid the asteroids, alien
cosmonauts, malfunctioning robodestructors, landers, lunar pods, robots, etc.

16 different levels of ice cold, low pressure death awaits you.

89598.name: Space Hunter (1985)
89598.description:
Game box

The world is starving and the only food available is in space. You must search through 15 star systems to feed the world. This complex 3-D simulation takes you from a rookie pilot to the hero of the world... if you're good enough!

Parts of the game are 3D flight simulation, parts top-down platform mazes.

89599.name: Zulu, Battle of Isandhlwana
89599.description:
"Zulu, Battle of Isandhlwana" is a game that simulates the battle between British imperial forces and Zulu warriors on January 22nd, 1879 in Zululand, and area northeast of what is today the Republic of South Africa. This battle is known as the worst disaster suffered by colonial troops in a confrontation against native forces.

This DTP publication by Luis Carreño Joicey, deals with the history of the battle and includes a detailed simulation of the conflict which will help to better understand what happened.

One player plays the with the British side and the other with the Zulu side, if there are two players. Additional players may take command of individual Zulu formations (the "horns", "chest" and "loins").

The basic game serves only to as an introduction and to let players familiarize themselves with with the rules; players should use the advanced rules for a more complete game.

89601.name: Headache
89601.description:
A basic platform game of carrying impulses around a human head while avoiding the bad guys.

Game box

Nervous Ned's job is to carry impulses from one part of the Head to the other while avoiding those subliminal nasties - The Throbs. But if he doesn't stop the Head Banger from hammering the Brain you're going to get an ENORMOUS H-E-A-D-A-C-H-E!!!

89602.name: Knightmare
videogameversion: English/European Amstrad CPC 3" Floppy Disk edition
89602.description:
3D puzzle adventure game based on the popular children's TV show of the same name.

Game box

I place you somewhere in time, in a land where strangers are not welcome. Search Damonia Castle for objects which may help free you from the clutches of the dark castle. Your advisors are two oracles. One is good, and often gives correct clues. The bad oracle will do everything to throw the knight into danger and death. The knight may consult the oracles, but only one will answer. By studying the contents of both oracles' statements, valuable clues may be learned.

89603.name: Lancer Lords
89603.description:
Game box

Jousting on a flying ostrich will sap your strength and stretch your sanity. Drop your lance and you're dead. Too much haste and you perish. Lose sight of an enemy egg and you're finished. As you flap your wings to move around the screen you have to be constantly alert to hold on to your three lives. This joust is no jest.

Climb onto your mighty ostrich, level your lance, make sure of your balance, take off and do combat. Your main objective is to stay alive, and that's hard enough. With careful control of the ostriches wings and direction, you must destroy the rest of the buzzards in the arena. The only way to do this is to "joust" with them. You must involve yourself in a high speed collision with one of these ugly specimens. On contact you must ensure that your lance is above theirs - else you will end up as buzzard bait. But should you survive this collision,
your opponent will dissolve in a puff of smoke and drop an egg to the ground. You must destroy this egg by jumping on top of it whilst avoiding the swooping movements of the other ostriches. If you fail to destroy the egg quickly it will mutate and hatch into another of these evil beasts.

On lower levels with only 3 or so ostriches, it is only hard, but as you move onto arenas with at least seven ostriches, you will find that it is virtually impossible especially as the eggs will mutate in just a few moments.

89604.name: Glitter Gulch
89604.description: The object of Glitter Gulch is to win one million dollars gambling. Player landing upon a casino play roulette or chuck-o-luck. Players not gambling on a given turn may make side bets with one another.

89605.name: Nahua
89605.description:
Nahua is an solo dice game of the Aztec civilization.

In this game you take on the role of head priest of Tenochtitlan, jewel of the cities of the Nahua. You must appease the god of the darkness with sacrifices while making sure that your civilization grows and flourishes. There are 20 rounds to the game representing the daynames of the Aztec calendar cycle, and to win you must offer up 26 sacrificial hearts or the sun will not rise again and the world will end.

You begin the game with 3 harvest dice (white) and 2 city dice (yellow). Later you will have access to four additional expansion dice. These dice show a variety of resource icons:

corn, useful to harvest to feed your people, extra corn can be stored from one round to the next

black corn, which you may not harvest, and can mean famine and death if have 3 or more ears of it

peasants, who can multiply your harvest yield with their hard work

priests, who can cause your civilization to expand

hearts, with which you must to appease Tezacatipoca

warriors, who can gain you captured slaves for your sacrifices

gods, which come with expansion dice, who can give you divine bonus resources

During the game you must keep track of corn and hearts as well as rounds.

Play:
There are 3 rolls allowed per round, and you must lock a die each roll, re-rolling any others you choose; with the exception of black corn which is always automatically locked on a roll (i.e. you are not allowed to re-roll a die showing the black corn icon, unless there is divine intervention). Some dice have 2 icons on a face; in this case both roll resources showing can be used. You must harvest enough corn in each round to feed all city and expansion dice being rolled (i.e. ears of corn=number of city and expansion dice rolled). At the start of the game this means you must harvest 2 ears of corn for each round, one for each of the city dice. As your civilization grows and you gain expansion dice, the number of ears of corn required will grow as well. If you do not have enough ears of corn to equal your rolled city and expansion dice (and you must use any stored corn you have as part of this), you must subtract 1 heart from your total (corn harvest may be saved from round to round).

During the game you may gain additional expansion dice. These dice are a darker orange and have a set of black dots (1 to 4 dots) on one face and the great jaguar god is displayed in white. You gain these expansion dice in numerical order and they will give you extra peasants, priests, corn to harvest, warriors and hearts as well as gods to pray to.

Game End:
If after 20 rounds you have offered up 26 sacrificial hearts you have won and the world is safe for another calendar cycle.

89606.description:
Unofficial fan expansion of Catan: Cities & Knights.

Adds several new aspects to Catan: Cities and Knights.

Introduces an Inquisitor token, Religion Development Calendars, Religion Progress card set, Bread commodity cards and Beer commodity cards. While Bread is analogous to Grain (the way Coin is analogous to Ore in Cities and Knights), Beer is a commodity that can only be produced on a Grain intersection when a new Diocese building is present. Beer is used to create Beer Festivals which affect an opponent's Road, Ship, Settlement or City for a period of time; this action can lower the Victory Point total for that opponent!

The third edition of Kirche, Glaube & Reformation ("Church, Faith and Reformation") also incorporates another unofficial fan expansion, Hexen, Zauberer & Drachen (Fan expansion to Catan: Cities and Knights) ("Witches, Wizards & Dragons"), which introduces a Wizard token, Magic Development Calendars, Magic Progress card set and Magic commodity cards. Magic commodities can only be collected on a brick intersection when a new Citadel building is present.

This combined version requires a custom 12 sided event die (6 barbarian ships and 6 city gates, the last of which is a "wild card" gate allowing the player who rolled the dice to choose the color gate).

If played separately, each fan expansion requires a custom 8 or 10 sided event side (4 barbarian ships and 4 city gates or 5 barbarian ships and 5 city gates, the last of which is a "wild card" gate).

Adds tactical complexity to the game and game length.

Belongs to the Catan Series.
89606.name: Kirche, Glaube & Reformation (Fan expansion to Catan: Cities and Knights)

89607.name: Disc Drivin'
89607.description:
User Summary

This is a PitchCar/Carabande clone for iPhone/iPod Touch. It's turn-based racing game in which you swipe your finger to flick a disc around a track in a game world with full 3D physics. This game goes one better than PitchCar/Carabande by introducing track hazards and special powers. Features pass n' play, WIFI, Bluetooth, and online asynchronous play.

89608.name: De Cao-Bang à Kaboul
89608.description:
(from Histoire & Collections webpage:)

en français:
De Cao-Bang à Kaboul, ou DCK, est une règle d’escarmouche moderne qui vous permettra de rejouer tous les engagements militaires à petite échelle depuis la fin de la seconde guerre mondiale jusqu’à nos jours.



(BGG user translation and description:)

In English :
De Cao-Bang à Kaboul (or DCK) - from Cao-Bang to Kabul - is a modern skirmish rule which will allow you to replay all small scale military engagements from the end of the WWII to our days.

The players take each one a group of infantry and command squads which can have vehicle support (some 10 miniatures each in the smallest scenarios).

The objectives of the game are decided by the same players or can be used those from the scenarios which came with the rulebook
The game uses a classic I go, you go turn sequence which have 4 sub-phases for each player:
a) rally
b) localization of the enemy
c) movement or fire
d) melee.
There is also an advance rules section to add optional elements to the main rules.
IN FRENCH ONLY.

89609.name: See How They Run
89609.description:
A game for up to 5 children.

It is an interactive race game where the player whose mouse gets into the house first is the winner.

There is not dice in this game. Each player gets one mouse and a counter. There is also a cat which is used to mark a different color each turn.

The players take turns to guess in which hand other players hide the counters. If they guess right, they move their mouse to the next color space that matches the color marked by the cat. If they guess wrong, then it is the challenged player who advances the mouse in the same way.

If the cat catches a slow mouse, gues what! the slow mouse is not penalized, instead it gets to advance 3 spaces. A quick, fun, and easy game for 4 years-old upwards.

89610.name: Mr. M' s谋杀法则：拜占庭刺客
89610.description:
Mr.M’s Code of Murder：The Byzantine Assassin

In the still of the night, Mr M sneaks into the decadent palace of nobles to exact his vengeance under his mask.

A sharp call fills the air, waking the depraved nobles from their dreams of avarice and greed. The duchess has fallen!

A murder note written on lamb skin lays at the side.

"God's Judgement is at Hand, and the guilty will be purged!"

The queen stares in shock at the brutal murder, the duke watches his companions with suspicion. The bard is playing his lute on the balcony. The old scholar strokes his beard. The maid is trembling in the corner and a mysterious smile hangs on the corner of the jester's face. Mr M remains hidden amongst them, poised to exact his justice...

This is cooperative deduction game that pits 1 player against the remaining players who seeks to deduce the identity after 5 rounds or characters have been eliminated.

The 13 characters are placed in the palace and the player playing Mr M receives 10 Murder cards. Mr M takes the top 2 cards from the Suspects deck and picks 1 as his character.

The turn continues with Character cards laid out (exact number based on players) in a row. The other players take turns activating 1 of the laid out Character card (the activated character then moves and activate his/her ability if necessary)each in order to deduce Mr M's identity and/or limit his killing options. Lastly, Mr M either activates the 2 remaining unused characters or 1 of the used characters. He finishes off his turn by playing a Murder card that kills one of the other characters in the palace, following all the rules and limitations listed on the murder card. The other players know which character died - but they do not know how. The used Murder card is then placed over the Character card of the murdered character.

After 5 rounds or 5 characters have been killed, whichever is earlier, players would have to deduce the identity of Mr M.

If a character is moved into a murdered character's location, the players can reveal the Murder card and use the information to isolate their suspect. For example, the Murder card:Death by Hanging might read; use to kill any one character in a room that is in the same column of rooms as Mr M. Another Murder card:Gunpowder Plot, would say; kill all characters in a room adjacent to Mr M.

89611.name: Digger
89611.description:
"A shower of gold nuggets ...
An hidden hourglass, unleashed gold diggers. Roll the dice as many times as you want to collect as many gems as possible in the allotted time.

A cascade of bad faith!
Be careful to your mates, who push you to stop digging too soon or to continue to play while the clock is ticking!" (Asmodée)

Digger is a fast game of dice rolling with a twist : you only have 30 seconds to collect the more gems you can and pile them on your board. You can take them from the stock or try to steal them from the other gold diggers. But the hourglass is hidden by the player on your right and if you don't pile all your gems in the allotted time, you'll lose them all.

89612.name: Magic the Gathering: Battlegrounds
89612.description:
Battlegrounds is a real-time adaptation of Magic: The Gathering. Players build 10-card decks out of a selection of about 60 cards; cards are real magic cards, but some are modified slightly for balance.

When a duel begins, each player only starts with 1 mana crystal. Mana crystals gradually appear as the duel goes on (more slowly the longer the duel lasts), giving you access to more expensive spells. Duelists can summon creatures that attack enemy creatures or duelists, cast enchantments to give a global effect, or cast spells to cause various effects such as buffing their creatures. The duelist can also perform a weak melee attack that deals 1 damage to a nearby creature.

As in the card game, players start with 20 life, and lose when their life is reduces to 0. Decks can consist of 1 or 2 of the 5 Magic colors.

User Summary

89613.name: Old Dragon:  Módulo Básico
89613.description:
From the book flap

"Old Dragon é um RPG de fantasia medieval e de capa e espada, construído tomando por base as versões mais antigas do RPg de fantasia mais famoso do mundo, seguindo a tradição old school desse tipo de jogo.

É um RPG onde magos, bárbaros e ladrões invadem masmorras infestadas de monstros, viajam por mares desconhecidos, montam dragões como se fossem cavalos, enfretam deuses e encontram itens mágicos milenares em cidades arruinadas e esquecidas.

Um jogo onde não existem limites para a imaginação dos jogadores e do mestre, em que o impossível acontece e a vida e a morte andam por cima do fio de uma espada afiada."

Translated to english:
"Old Dragon is a medieval fantasy RPG of sword and sorcery, created from the older versions of most famous fantasy RPG in the world, following the old school tradition of this game.

Its a RPG where mages, barbarians and thieves conquer monster infested dungeons, travel through dangerous seas, ride dragons as if they were horses, challange the gods e find ancient magical artifacts in ruined and forgotten cities.

A game with no limit for players imagination, where the impossible happens end life and death walk through a sharp sword."

89614.name: Monopoly: York Edition
89614.description: A version of the classic game Monopoly, with names and images of board elements taken from York, England.

89615.name: Corre que te pillo
89615.description:
Cats and Mice run around the board in a crazy race to save their skins (box text).

Funny game in which each player must move his mice to the finish line, while at the same time tries to get the more the better of the other players mice.
The winner is the player with most points at the end of the game (from the game rules).

Gatos y ratones corren por el tablero en una loca carrera para salvar el pellejo (box text)

Juego muy divertido en que cada jugador debe avanzar sus ratones hasta la meta, mientras intenta comer el máximo de ratones de los otros jugadores.
El ganador es quién consigue más puntos al finalizar el juego.

89616.description:
Hungry Dinosaurs roam through their territories searching for food. But if the little dinosaurs are too greedy, the dangerous T-Rex takes his chance. Who gets the biggest pray in the end? A card game where you shouldn't be greedy.

This is a push-your-luck game.
First you gamble with your 2 dino-cards where you will look for food (in 2 out of 3 places). Luck then decides in what 2 places you can roam for food. On your turn you open the cards finding food. You can turn cards as long as you want. But there are T-Rex in the cards to and if you draw one you loose all the food you found. So try to gather enough but don't push your luck.

Components:
3 territory tokens
3 territory cards
8 dinosaur cards
60 pray cards
The game is part of the T-RexWorld line of Die Spiegelburg.
89616.name: Fette Beute

89618.name: Bx Rock, Paper, Scissors, Fire and Water
89618.description: Bx Rock, Paper, Scissors, Fire and Water (BxRPSFW) is an abstract strategy board game for 2 players. Each of the 2 players takes turns moving one of his/her 17 game pieces which include Rock, Paper, Scissors, Fire and Water. Rock captures Scissors, Scissors captures Paper, and Paper captures Rock. In addition to this, Fire may capture any of Rock, Paper, or Scissors. Any of Rock, Paper, or Scissors may capture Water. And Water captures only Fire. No like pieces may capture each other. The object of the game is to be the first player to capture the opposing flag, which may not move at all.

89620.name: Monopoly: Canada (Electronic Banking)
89620.description:
The modern Canadian edition of the classic real estate game. Buy properties, build houses and hotels, collect rent from fellow players. This edition includes Canadian cities as voted for in an online contest poll in early 2010, and uses an electronic banking device to replace paper money. Player tokens are also replaced with more modern items, and dollar values of properties, rents and fees have been increased to more comtemporary amounts.

From the back of the box:

"Make millions with the swipe of a card! Wheel and deal your way to a fortune even faster using debit cards instead of cash. All it takes is a card swipe for money to change hands. Now you can collect rent, buy properties and pay fines - all with the touch of a button! It's a new way to play the family classic that's been brought up-to-date with higher property values and locations based on your favourite Canadian cities!"

89621.name: Teen Titans
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
89621.description:
From the back of the game case
Calling all Teen Titans. An unexplained videogame has been sent to Titan Tower and it stars...the Teen Titans?! When they turn on the game, strange things begin to happen. Is the new game "playing" the Titans or has a mysterious villain breached their defenses and taken control of our heroes? Play as Robin, Starfire, Beast Boy, Cyborg, and Raven in a thrilling adventure that threatens to wipe out the Titans for good!

89622.name: Namco Museum 50th Anniversary
89622.description:
From the back of the game case:

The ultimate arcade collection...no quarters required! It's party time! Namco celebrates 50 years of bringing you the greatest games on the planet by releasing the biggest compilation of all-star arcade classics. Namco Museum 50th Anniversary features 14 of the most treasured Namco original games in arcade history.

89623.name: Superman: Shadow of Apokolips
89623.description:
From the back of the game case:
This is a job for Superman! Horrific weapons from the planet Apokolips have fallen into the hands of super-villains. Only Superman has the power to thwart their insidious plot to take over the world.

89624.name: Acid Arrow
89624.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Behind the Spells pdf series continues with the acid arrow spell! This series examines those spells from the SRD that are listed time and again on character sheets throughout gaming.

These are the spells which, if on your PC's class list, will be taken as soon as possible and include such quintessential favorites as magic missile and fireball. Each pdf in this series examines the spellcaster who created the spell, one or more of the spell's hidden capabilities, and possible variants for the spell.

Includes two new spells!

89625.name: Animate Dead
89625.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Behind the Spells pdf series continues with the popular animate dead spell! This series examines those spells from the SRD that are listed time and again on character sheets throughout gaming.

These are the spells which, if on your PC's class list, will be taken as soon as possible and include such quintessential favorites as magic missile and fireball. Each pdf in this series examines the spellcaster who created the spell, one or more of the spell's hidden capabilities, and possible variants for the spell.

Includes one animate dead variant and a new weapon quality!

89626.name: Antimagic Field
89626.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Behind the Spells pdf series continues with the popular antimagic field spell! This series examines those spells from the SRD that are listed time and again on character sheets throughout gaming.

These are the spells which, if on your PC's class list, will be taken as soon as possible and include such quintessential favorites as magic missile and fireball. Each pdf in this series examines the spellcaster who created the spell, one or more of the spell's hidden capabilities, and possible variants for the spell.

Includes two new magic items!

89627.description:
Napoleon's Final Campaign: Germany, 4-6 September, 1813

Napoleonic 20 #11 (Germany 20 #3) Expansion Kit

Designer Lance McMillan offers a fascinating Expansion Kit for Grossbeeren 20, placing you in command of either the Coalition forces or the French army. The French forces are small, but nimble, pitted against their larger opponent. As at Grossbeeren, the Allied army's initial deployment is its greatest weakness – if the French can move quickly they can over-whelm the Prussians and occupy the Juterbog objective before the rest of the Allied army can be brought to bear. But can the French keep Ney in command of an army rather than personally leading a charge?

NOTE, Dennewitz 20 is not a ‘stand alone’ game. You must own a copy of Grossbeeren 20 to use this expansion kit.
89627.name: Dennewitz 20

89628.name: Blade Barrier
89628.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Behind the Spells pdf series continues with the popular blade barrier spell! This series examines those spells from the SRD that are listed time and again on character sheets throughout gaming.

These are the spells which, if on your PC's class list, will be taken as soon as possible and include such quintessential favorites as magic missile and fireball. Each pdf in this series examines the spellcaster who created the spell, one or more of the spell's hidden capabilities, and possible variants for the spell.

IIncludes one blade barrier variant.

89629.description:

Each pdf in this series examines the spellcaster who created the spell, one or more of the spell's hidden capabilities, and possible variants for the spell.

Includes one bless variant and a new item!

89630.name: Burning Hands
rpghonor: 2005 Indie RPG Awards - Best Support - Runner Up
89630.description:

Each pdf in this series examines the spellcaster who created the spell, one or more of the spell's hidden capabilities, and possible variants for the spell.

Includes a magical poison and a new item.

Each pdf in this series examines the spellcaster who created the spell, one or more of the spell's hidden capabilities, and possible variants for the spell.

Includes a place of power!

89633.name: Dancing Lights
89633.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Behind the Spells pdf series continues with the dancing lights spell! This series examines those spells from the SRD that are listed time and again on character sheets throughout gaming.

These are the spells which, if on your PC's class list, will be taken as soon as possible and include such quintessential favorites as magic missile and fireball. Each pdf in this series examines the spellcaster who created the spell, one or more of the spell's hidden capabilities, and possible variants for the spell.

Includes one dancing lights variant, a new magic item, and the Dancing Lights Game that your spellcasting characters can play.

89634.name: Disintegrate
89634.description:

Includes two disintegrate variants!

Each pdf in this series examines the spellcaster who created the spell, one or more of the spell's hidden capabilities, and possible variants for the spell.

Includes two disintegrate variants!

89636.name: Fire Shield
89636.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Behind the Spells pdf series continues with the fire shield spell! This series examines those spells from the SRD that are listed time and again on character sheets throughout gaming.

These are the spells which, if on your PC's class list, will be taken as soon as possible and include such quintessential favorites as magic missile and fireball. Each pdf in this series examines the spellcaster who created the spell, one or more of the spell's hidden capabilities, and possible variants for the spell.

Includes two fire shield variants!

89637.name: Fireball
89637.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Behind the Spells pdf series continues with the popular fireball spell! This series examines those spells from the SRD that are listed time and again on character sheets throughout gaming.

These are the spells which, if on your PC's class list, will be taken as soon as possible and include such quintessential favorites as magic missile and fireball. Each pdf in this series examines the spellcaster who created the spell, one or more of the spell's hidden capabilities, and possible variants for the spell.

Includes two fireball variants!

89638.name: Guards & Wards
89638.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Behind the Spells pdf series continues with the guards & wards spell! This series examines those spells from the SRD that are listed time and again on character sheets throughout gaming.

These are the spells which, if on your PC's class list, will be taken as soon as possible and include such quintessential favorites as magic missile and fireball. Each pdf in this series examines the spellcaster who created the spell, one or more of the spell's hidden capabilities, and possible variants for the spell.

Includes a new magic item!

89639.name: Hold Person
89639.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Behind the Spells pdf series continues with the hold person spell! This series examines those spells from the SRD that are listed time and again on character sheets throughout gaming.

These are the spells which, if on your PC's class list, will be taken as soon as possible and include such quintessential favorites as magic missile and fireball. Each pdf in this series examines the spellcaster who created the spell, one or more of the spell's hidden capabilities, and possible variants for the spell.

Includes two hold person variants.

89641.name: Classified Information
rpgitemversion: Print on demand version by Publit
89641.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Ett agentnätverk byggs upp I en främmande stat. Vem är spindeln i nätet?

En privat intressegrupp lejer en frilansare for datastöld. Vad hoppas de finna?

Avdelningen för kontraspionage jobbar dag och natt. Lyckas de lokalisera cellen innan det är för sent?

Jourhavande insatsstyrka är satt i högsta beredskap. Vem utrustar gruppen de sätts in emot gång på gång?

Radarparet från interntutredningen jagar mullvaden i en katt-och-råtta-lek med dödlig utgång. Vem är vän och vem är fiende?

10 timmar västerut agerar specialstyrkan på underrättelserna. Vilket öde går dem till mötes?

Alla är möjliga scenarion i Classified Information, de nutida agentrollspelet.

Vad väntar ni på? Skapa rollpersoner och börja spela!


User Translation from Swedish:

A network is built up in a foreign country. Who is their leader?
A private interest group pays for data theft. What are they hoping to find?
The department for contra espionage works night and day. Will they succeed in localizing the cell before it is too late?

The task force on duty is on highest alert. Who equips the group they are targeting time after time?

The pair from internal investigations chases the mole with deadly outcome. Who is friend and who is foe?

10 hours to the west, the special task force is acting on the intelligence information. What is their destiny?

All of this is possible scenarios in Classified Information, the contemporary agent role playing game.

What are you waiting for? Create characters and start to play!

89642.name: Classified Information: Vapenmodul
89642.description:
User Summary:

A weapons module for Classified Information, intended to give extra details on and around weapons. The focus is on individual weapons while the core rule book has the more general rules.

Published as a free PDF.

89643.name: Atlantis Evolution
89643.description:
From the publisher's website:

1904. On his way back to New York, Curtis Hewitt, a young adventurer and photographer, is caught in a vortex that sends him to the heart of the lost city of Atlantis…

A stranger in a land of hi-tech and archaic faith, Curtis endures thrilling adventure helping the people of Atlantis overthrow the mighty ‘Atlantian’ Gods.

89644.name: Thousand Arms
89644.description:
The Dark Acolytes, a mysterious organization of cyborgs and robots, is trying to find the five legendary Sacred Flames, and bring chaos to the World in the process. Meis, a womanizing "Spirit Blacksmith" with the ability to make magical weapons, finds himself chosen to find the flames before the Dark Acolytes do. However, to increase the power of his weapons, Meis must have the help of a woman, and must increase his 'intimacy level' with her by going out on dates. Along his journey, he meets a colorful cast of characters, including girls to date and heroes who join his party.

Combat in Thousand Arms is turn based, with up to three party members to be taken into battle at once. However, only the front character is actually able to physically attack the enemy. The other two characters serve in a supporting role, taunting the enemy and utilizing certain items or spells (the enemies have the same limitations.) If necessary, characters can be rotated out such that one of the support characters and the lead character exchange position

The key feature in this game which distinguishes it from most other RPGs is its built-in mini-dating simulation. Thousand Arms' dating sim features dating locations in many of its major cities and towns, and a cast of nine women. The dating aspect allows the player to pick dialogue choices.
The dating aspect also has an actual in-game effect. By successfully wooing each female, her intimacy level can be slowly raised. As this level rises, it grants her the ability to imbue weapons with increasingly powerful spells and skills. This magical forging, which is possible due to Meis' training as a Spirit Blacksmith, relies on the smith having established such positive female relationships.

Source: Wikipedia, "Thousand Arms", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89645.name: Trauma Center: Under the Knife 2
89645.description:
User Summary

This DS-exclusive sequel to the original Trauma Center: Under the Knife continues the adventures of Derek Stiles and Angie as another GUILT outbreak occurs.

89646.name: Valkyrie Profile: Covenant of the Plume
89646.description:
The third installment of the Valkyrie Profile series. This time the game is an isometric tactical RPG.

Ten year old Wylfred lives in the village of Tourque with his friends Ancel and Tilte, sister Elsie, mother Margot, and father Thyodor, a soldier. One day, Thyodor's friend Duwain arrives with news that Thyodor has fallen in battle, a Valkyrie's plume on his corpse indicating he was taken as an Einherjar, which Duwain gives to Wylfred. Thyodor's death leaves his family in poverty, Elsie dies of starvation, and Margot goes mad from grief. Wylfred becomes bitter and cynical, vowing vengeance on the reaper of his father's soul.

Years later, Wylfred leaves his mother and becomes a mercenary, hoping that he may also become an Einherjar and get his revenge on the Valkyrie. Ancel follows him, hoping to divert him from his quest. During a battle at Aullewyn Keep, Wylfred is mortally wounded and hears Queen Hel's voice, asking if he will do anything for revenge. Wylfred says yes and awakens to find the Valkyrie's feather in his hand, not fully understanding what he has done. Wylfred and Ancel are called upon to fight again and, outnumbered and outmatched, Wylfred invokes the Plume upon his friend. The incantation increases Ancel's strength and they defeat their opponents but Ancel dies afterward. Hel then delivers to Wylfred a woman named Ailyth, who is to accompany him and act as a contact between Wylfred and Hel.

Source: Wikipedia, "Valkyrie Profile: Covenant of the Plume", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89647.name: Wario Ware Inc. Mega Party Game$
videogamehonor: 2004 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Innovation of the Year Winner
2005 D.I.C.E. Family Game of the Year Nominee (Console)
89647.description:
User Summary

The second WarioWare game in the series, this one is multiplayer-focused. The microgames themselves have been recycled from the first game, but this game includes several multiplayer modes to make this a party game.

89648.name: WarioWare: Snapped
89648.description:
User Summary

A small DSiWare title, WarioWare: Snapped! makes use of the DSi's camera to control the game by tracking player movements.

89649.name: WarioWare: D.I.Y.
89649.description:
User Summary

This entry in the WarioWare series allows players to create their own microgames. User-created microgames can be downloaded from the Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection and traded with friends. The companion WiiWare title WarioWare: DIY Showcase allows users to play these games on the Wii.

89650.name: WarioWare D.I.Y. Showcase
89650.description:
User Summary

This WiiWare companion title to the DS' WarioWare D.I.Y. contains an all-new story mode with unique microgames, new multiplayer modes, and allows users to synch with their copies of WarioWare DIY and play their creations on the big screen using the Wii's IR remote.

89651.name: Age of Conan: Rise of the Godslayer
89651.description:
From the press release:

"Explore the whole new land of Khitai in Rise of the Godslayer - the first expansion pack for Age of Conan.

The eastern empire of Khitai!

Explore many new world regions such as Northern Grasslands, Chosain Province, and Gateway to Khitai. This new land offers ample opportunities to explore vast landscapes such as mountains, jungles, plains, and even some areas that defy all laws of nature.

Pick your side!

An all-new faction system has been introduced, allowing players to join one of many warring factions in Khitai. Take on jobs for them, rise in their ranks and collect the rewards. And maybe you will betray them in the end as you swear allegiance to their enemies?

Ride the Tiger and the Wolf!

Acquire the Wolf and the Tiger, two new mounts available in the expansion! But that is not an easy task, for you must train them and nurture them as they grow from being a cub and into being a powerful battle companion.

Alternate advancement system!

You can now take your character even further by exploring the all-new alternate advancement system. Acquire new powers and abilities, and even progress while your character is logged out. The new system will take your character further than ever before!

New content, new experiences!

You can now start out as a Khitan and head straight to Khitai after your time on Tortage Island is over. Experience content across several level ranges, and unlock a vast number of fantastic new armor pieces, incredible weapons, and numerous other exclusive rewards."

89652.description:
Sword & Shield is a tactical game of fantasy combat for 2 or more players. Using playing cards, figures, and a chess or checkers board you can fight out gritty fantasy battles.

The heart of the system lies in using a standard deck of 54 cards. These govern your ability to move and fight. Your ability to play the cards to your advantage will determine victory more so than simple luck of the draw.

Sword & Shield combines card drawing, tactical card play, and fantasy miniatures maneuvering into a simple 2 pages of rules!

This first release contains: Humans, Elves, Dwarves, Orcs Goblins, Giant Spiders, Skeletons, Zombies, Lizardmen and the dreaded Cthull all await your presence in the arena!

Pick up your copy of Sword & Shield, and let the battle begin!
89652.name: Sword & Shield: 54 Card Combat

89653.name: Legend of Zord
89653.description:
User Summary

Legend of Zord is a third-person action game in which Prince Raymond goes on a quest to avenge an attack on the land of Zord by the king of the bordering kingdom of Askhar.

89654.name: Diamond Dan
89654.description:
Diamond Dan is Grendel Games' latest casual arcade 3D platform game for PC and Mac. Guide Dan or Ann down the Towers of Treasure, but beware of a thousand dangers that await!

Addictive casual platform game with a twist!

Make your way down the towers of treasure collecting Gems and gold!

Avoid deadly pitfalls and traps in randomly generated levels!

Choose Diamond Dan or Diamond Ann and use their unique bonus moves!

Source: The Developer Website.

89655.name: Ishin-Kaiten
89655.description:
An amateur cardgame describing the chaotic history in the end of Edo government, (Bakumatsu).

The game contains 99 cards and one small map.
The game is very similar to "Uno". Every player has a turn and try to play a card which matches either color or number to the last card played. And when any one player plays all his hand, the game ends and the victory is determined by each player's secret victory condition.

The map shows the current trend and changed its status by playing some cards. This trend strongly affects the victory condition.

89656.name: DogFighter
89656.description:
Dogfighter is a fast paced, arcade aerial combat game with arena style gameplay values. Players can do battle in single player, or compete against up to 7 players in multiplayer game modes, using beefed up biplanes sporting over 20 different offensive and defensive weapons.
Using a state-of-the-art flight model and controls,ensure that players will have unprecedented command of DogFighter's craft. Complete control of the craft, combined with easily executed advanced manoeuvres such as the Barrel Roll, give DogFighter players the tools they need to master the skies.
With environments built to both slay and save you, the environments in DogFighter offer the player a more interactive experience than is usual for the genre. Players can enjoy piloting their craft down mining tunnels, through pyramids and active volcanoes, in leves designed to deliver a more varied, more interactive gaming experience. Fly low, fly fast!

Source: The Developer Website.

89657.name: Guns of Icarus
89657.description:
User Summary

In Guns of Icarus, you play as a privateer operating an airship to transport goods in a steampunk future while fending off pirate attacks.

89658.name: Glendale's Powerbroker
89658.description: Similar to Monopoly but with added elements. Players can take out loans and there are opportunities to "cheat" the other players or raid their properties. You roll and move around a board like Monopoly and land on businesses, but there is also a secondary track called the high-roller track.

89659.name: Secret of the Magic Crystals
89659.description:
User Summary

In this game, you manage a horse-breeding farm in which you can raise mythical horselike creatures such as Pegasus and Unicorns.

89660.name: Windosill
89660.description:
User Summary

Windosill is a point-and-click adventure/puzzle game set in surrealistic, dreamlike environments.

89661.name: Zen Bound 2
89661.description:
Zen Bound 2 is a meditative puzzle game of wrapping rope around wooden sculptures. It is a tactile game, with a focus on making wood and stone look and feel real and believable.

The highlights of Zen Bound 2 are its controls and its atmosphere. The game teakes full advantage of tilt and multi-touch and feels natural and comfortable to play. The dusty and soothing atmosphere is a combination of beautiful visuals and a unique soundtrack by 'Ghost Monkey'.

GAME FEATURES

Over 100 levels
New gameplay modes with paint bombs
Highly detailed visuals, gorgeous on the iPad screen, optimized for FullHD and higher resolutions on PC and Mac
Intuitive and natural multi-touch controls on iOS and Mac(tilt supported)
New 'Ghost Monkey' music for a total soundtrack length of 45 minutes
All levels from the original Zen Bound, all with visual upgrades, some with new gameplay
Tree of Tribute, featuring guest stars from independently developed iPhone games

Source: The Game Website.

89662.name: Archon Classic
89662.description:
User Summary

Archon Classic is a remake of the 1983 game Archon: The Light and the Dark, a fantasy strategy game in which pieces take turns moving around a game board, then engage in real-time combat when they meet opposing pieces. New features in Archon Classic include support for four players, new game maps, and several new unit types.

89663.name: Fratzen schneiden
89663.description:
This game is for very young audiences, and get to know different feelings by making facial expression.

The rules are quite simple:

- Draw a card: happy, laughing, funny, surprised, sad, hiding, angry
- Make an apropiate expression
- move the the meeple to the new position on the board

for 2-4 players, age above 3
includes - Playing Board, Meeples and playing cards

89664.name: CityProGame München
89664.description:
Using the detailed street map of Munich (München), which is set out in four colors, each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the center as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.

Once a player manages to place all five companies on the map, the game ends and the each player caluculates the combined value of his companies to evaluate a winner.

Contents: 80 cards, 8 counters, 3 dice, rules in 4 languages) and city information.

89666.name: Tweeners
89666.description:
"It's the word in-between that counts! Beat the clock... and double your score."

A party-style game of finding a word to fit between two others, that forms the second half of a common two-word phrase with the first word and the first words of a common two-word phrase with the second word.

89667.name: Gatecrashing
rpghonor: 2011 ENnie for Product of the Year - Nominee
89667.description:
User Summary

The long awaited exoplanet exploration guide for Eclipse Phase. At last players can go through the pandora gates and explore strange new worlds, seek out new life and new civilizations, and boldly go where no transhuman has gone before.

boardgamehonor: 2011 Golden Geek Best Abstract Board Game Nominee
2012 Golden Geek Best Abstract Board Game Nominee
89668.description:
In Reiner Knizia's BITS – a successor to his own FITS – all players are active at the same time and have their own board on which they will place multicolored tiles each turn. The game last three rounds, with players scoring points at the end of each round.

At the start of each round, players reveal a communal task card, which is added to any other task cards in play. If a player creates the shapes depicted or create colored groups of the appropriate size, she'll gain or lose points as shown on the task card(s). Each player then randomly determines a different starting tile for the round and places it on her board. Then the building cards are revealed one at a time, and all players take the tile shown and add it to their board by placing it in the top row of their row, then letting it slide down into place among the other tiles. This continues until all tiles have been placed.

Players then score (or lose) points for the round, and the player with the highest score after three rounds wins! Players can complete an optional fourth round, if desired, and the rules also contain scoring targets for solitaire play.
89668.name: BITS

89669.name: Arc of Yesod
89669.description:
User Summary
Arc of Yesod is a sequel to Nodes of Yesod.
Story continues - destruction of communication monolith was not successful and its creators managed to salvage it. Now its up to protagonist to travel to their home planet Ariat and finish the job started.

Gameplay is similar as the first part. It consists of wandering through cavern areas, fighting enemies, collecting crystals, all in the manner of side-scroller.
Single player only.

89670.name: Nodes of Yesod
89670.description:
User Summary

Main player, astronaut Charlie is set to investigate strange activity on the moon. Source of this activity is black monolith which is broadcasting mysterious signals.
Protagonist is sent to the moon caverns with the objective of discovering eight crystals and finding the monolith.

It is a classic side-scrolling game with few types of enemies - harmful and non-harmful. Charlie can jump very high, have to avoid other astronauts which will steal the crystals and use lunar moles to dig nev cavern areas.

89671.name: Arena Football
89671.description:
User Summary
This is a simulation of American football. It's a text-only sport simulation. Player is able to decide what type of offensive and defensive plays he wants to execute and the computer calculates the results based on various factors (such as real-life data and tendencies of the teams).

89672.name: Penta
89672.description:
The box includes: 125 triangular plastic tiles in 5 colours with values 1 to 5; 64 cardboard goal tiles (8 x 6 different types of increasing values); 5 dice (one for each color with numbers 1 to 5 and one star) and 4 game boards, one for each player.
Each of the game boards shows 3 empty pentagons (composed of 5 triangles each).

At the beginning of the game each player chooses 3 goal tile and puts them on his board under the empty pentagons..
At his turn the player throw the dice, gets the correspoding triangular tiles and places them on his board trying to complete his goals, Unused tile are placed back in the reserve.
When one goal is reached the player keeps the goal tile, gives back the triangles and takes a new goal tile.
The game cannot end before someone has collected at least five goal tiles.

Goal of the game is to score more points than the other players.

89673.name: Tower Blocks
89673.description:
User Summary

Tower Blocks is a browser game in which the player has to build a tower as high as possible.

A crane swings building blocks at the top of the screen and you click to let them drop and build with them. The idea is to let the fall on top of each other so that you get one high tower. For each block you can put on another you get points. You can drop 3 blocks next to the tower and then the game ends.

89675.name: Mario vs. Donkey Kong: Mini-Land Mayhem
videogameversion: North American Nintendo DS (Red Case) edition
89675.description:
User Summary

Mario vs. Donkey Kong returns with Mini-Land Mayhem. Again Mario is sending windup toys after the naughty Donkey Kong, but DK is back to his original hi-jinks, and has kidnapped dear Pauline. Mario must master manipulation of Mario, Toad, Peach, Donkey Kong, and Pauline wind-up toys (they all work the same, but sometimes each needs to go to separate exits).

The game permits wireless DS multi-card 2-player challenges, as well as sharing and downloading of levels via the internet.

As is the tradition for the series, after you complete the game, you discover you've only scratched the surface, and there are many more levels to conquer.

89676.name: Arnie
89676.description:
User Summary
Main protagonist of the game is Arnie, the soldier. His main task is to eliminate a number of terrorists battling through their camps. There is also an option of improving your weapon which increases his survival capabilities.
It is an action-packed shooter played in the manner of a side-scroller.

89677.name: Arnie 2
89677.description:
It is the sequel to Commodore 64 game Arnie. Theme and setting is very similar to its predecessor - fight and eradicate a number of enemy soldiers in various areas. Example of game locations are chemical plant, airfield, battleships and prisoner camp.
Ther are various powerups such as weapon improvements and first aid kits scattered throughout the game.

Source: User summary

89678.name: Artillery Duel
89678.description:
Artillery Duel takes gameplay common to many games of the time and adapts it to the limitations of the Atari 2600. The game consists of dueling cannons on either side of a hill or mountain of varying height and shape. Each player has control of the incline and force behind the shell launched, the objective being to score a direct hit on the opposing target. Artillery Duel lacks the wind variable featured in other variations on the theme. Where many versions gave the player a few tries on the same course, Artillery Duel switches to a new mountain after each turn. When the player does manage to hit the opposing cannon, the reward is a brief animation of comically marching soldiers at the bottom of the screen.

Source: Wikipedia, "Artillery Duel," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89679.name: The Astonishing Adventures of Mr. Weems and the She-Vampires
89679.description:
The player controls the eponymous Mr. Weems, the bespectacled protagonist who must wander through the six level, vampire-infested maze. The player fights vampires using his garlic gun. There is also a garlic pill which makes Mr. Weems immune from attack for a while.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Astonishing Adventures of Mr. Weems and the She-Vampires," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89680.description:
(from MMP website:)

The ASL Journal #9 is a 64-page magazine for fans of Advanced Squad Leader. This magazine is stuffed full of ASL goodness, including:

Verdict at Nuremberg mini-campaign game designed by Pete Shelling;

Suicide Creek campaign game with:
-24” x 26” map
-(180) x 1/2” counters and (64) x 5/8” counters
-Chapter Z rules pages Z63-Z78 with the Suicide Creek Campaign Game rule
-6 stand-alone scenarios (J131-J136)

The 24 scenarios (total, including Nuremberg and Suicide Creek) are:

J126 Ugly Faces (French/British vs. German, Nieuport, Belgium, 1940)
J127 Messervy’s Men (Italian vs. British, Tamanau Gap, Eritrea, 1940)
J128 Opium Hill (British vs. Japanese, Pasir Panjang, Malaya, 1942)
J129 Mountain Hunters (Russians vs. Romanian/German, Novo Shuli, Crimea, 1942)
J130 The Art of Dying (Russian vs. Italian, Kotovskij, Russia, 1942)
J131 First Love (Japanese vs. American, Cape Gloucester, New Britain, 1944)
J132 Jungle Infiltration (American vs. Japanese, Cape Gloucester, New Britain, 1944)
J133 One Miserable Night (American vs. Japanese, Cape Gloucester, New Britain, 1944)
J134 Kerry’s Crossing (Japanese vs. American, Cape Gloucester, New Britain, 1944)
J135 Diversion (Japanese vs. American, Cape Gloucester, New Britain, 1944)
J136 Muddy Mayhem (Japanese vs. American, Cape Gloucester, New Britain, 1944)
J137 No Mercy In Burcy (British vs. German, Burcy, France, 1944)
J138 Point to Make (German vs. British, Pont à Marcq, France, 1944)
J139 Light Aid Detached (Partisan/British vs. German, Lessines, Belgium, 1944)
J140 All Down The Line (German vs. British, Oosterbeek, Holland, 1944)
J141 Riding With The King (German vs. Russian, Nagykallo, Hungary, 1944)
J142 Penny Packets (American vs. German, Senonchamps, Belgium, 1944)
J143 Circle of Doom (German vs. American, Nuremberg, Germany, 1945)
J144 Three For The Third (German vs. American, Nuremberg, Germany, 1945)
J145 Golden Pheasants (German vs. American, Nuremberg, Germany, 1945)
J146 Ragnarök (German vs. Russian, Berlin, Germany, 1945)
VotG22 Bark You Dogs! (Russian vs. German, Stalingrad, Russia, 1942)
VotG23 Heroes of the Soviet Union (German vs. Russian, Stalingrad, Russia, 1942)
VotG24 Raid on Rodimtsev (Russian vs. German, Stalingrad, Russia, 1942)

AND there is plenty to read in this issue including:

-The Art of the Banzai by Bret Hildebran
-The Science of the Banzai by Jim Bishop
-Getting Your Feet Wet by Jon Neall
-Verdict at Nuremberg by Pete Shelling
-The Battle of Suicide Creek by Darrell Andersen
-The Last House on the Left: The Art of Key Building Control by Mark Pitcavage
-A Method to the Madness: How Scenario Designs Happen by Pete Shelling
-Spass mit Panzerfaust! by Tim Hunsdorfer
-The Red Barricades Project by Jim Aikens
89680.name: ASL Journal #9

89681.name: Atomic Robo-Kid
89681.description:
In the 21st century, a blast of cosmic radiation bombarded Terra-12, a deep-space outpost of Earth, hideously mutating all transplanted life. A fleet of savage beings followed the radiation wave and invaded the planet, and began the systematic destruction of all remaining sentient life. Years of battling the alien 'governors' have gone by, and now only one hope survives to avenge the desperate terran colonists.

The player controls the titular character through six stages of increasing difficulty, facing an alien "governor" boss (which are so large as to be considered levels in and of themselves, as some of the bosses take up several screens) at the end of each level, followed by a "duel" level against other Robo-Kid sized robots. Many levels branch into others, giving the player the choice over which zone to enter next, increasing playability.
Robo-Kid can collect four different weapons (whichever weapon is selected is lost when Robo-kid loses a life) in addition to his default gun, collect powerups for a shield that activates on enemy contact, plus rapid fire and speed powerups. The player can also encounter a friendly dinosaur-looking robot that sells weapons and shields to Robo-kid using extra lives as currency.

Platforms:
c64
SEGA Mega drive/Genesis

Source: Wikipedia, "Atomic Robo-Kid," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89682.name: Atomino
videogamedeveloper: Blue Byte Software GmbH (Blue Byte Studio GmbH)
89682.description:
Atomino is a 1990 computer puzzle game originally for the Amiga, Atari ST and DOS. A version was made for the Commodore 64 in 1991. The objective is to build molecules from atoms, with gradually increasing difficulty and speed.

Source: Wikipedia, "Atomino," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89683.name: ATV Simulator
89683.description:
The goal of the game is to drive your ATV through various courses which you must complete within the time limit without running out of fuel. If you crash your ATV, you can move your man to get back into the vehicle, however it will cost you precious seconds to do so. If you run out time or fuel, it is game over.

Source: Wikipedia, "ATV Simulator," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89684.name: Avenger
89684.description:
It is a clone of more famous game - Space Invaders.
Goal of the game is simple, to shoot aliens. Player can earn extra points by shooting flying saucers as well.

Source: User summary

89685.name: Avoid the Noid
89685.description:
Avoid the Noid is a platform computer game for the Commodore 64 and DOS, written in 1989 to promote Domino's Pizza. It was modeled after the company's ad campaign during the late 1980s. The ads featured a "noid" that destroyed pizzas and must be avoided.
The game uses various digitized versions of classical music for each level.

Source: Wikipedia, "Avoid the Noid," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89686.name: Track & Field Math
89686.description:
Track & Field Math is a game for children in grades 6 to 8 that uses a sports theme. It can be used to review for tests, brush up on a specific topic, or just for family fun.

There are eight "events" like the 100 meter dash, the pole vault, or the discus. Players roll dice to participate in the events and the first player to finish must answer the math question. Correct answers give the player a medal. The contestant with the highest medal total is declared the winner.

Includes a colorful board, 4 pawns, 120 question cards, a die, rules, score sheet, and a storage insert.

89687.name: Shakespell
89687.description:
From the rules sheet:

A pocket word dice game consisting of seven white letter dice and one black symbol dice. Comes in a drawstring bag.

Each player takes a turn to shake and throw the eight dice. Using the letters on the upturned faces of the seven white letter dice, the aim is to make the highest score possible by creating one or more words of two or more letters. Players decide the number of rounds they wish to play in each game.

Each dice has a score value and these are added together to get a total for the turn. The blank has no score value and may be used as any desired letter.

If all the letters can be used in making two or three words, an extra 5 points is added to the player's score for that turn.

Six letter words add 15 points to the player's score.

Seven letter words add 25 points to the player's score.

The black symbol dice affects the player's throw by adding or subtracting points, imposing a time limit, allowing a rethrow of all dice, prohibiting multiple words or adding an extra blank.

89688.name: Grim Pursuits
89688.description:
From the Introduction to the Book:

Grim Pursuits is the third installment of the Gathering Darkness Campaign. This publication follows the same basic pattern of Dark Despair in that it is mostly scenario with background information on the settlements and roadside inns the players are likely to pass through. The Karak Hirn sourcebook is a companion to Grim Pursuits. Even though the former publication is not necessary to run the scenario, it is recommended that the GM should have Karak Hirn: Heart of the Hornberg readily available.

Includes the scenario, maps and handouts with NPC statistics, appendices with new cults and spells and a gazetteer of Sudenland.

89689.name: You Stole My Radishes (TimCon IX Fanzine)
89689.description:
Fanzine for Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay given out at the TimCon IX convention, 29th May 2010.

Contents:

Editorial (Tim Eccles)

The Con Programme (Tim Eccles)

WFRP: the not Third Edition (Tim Eccles)

Geheimnisnacht and Hexensnacht - Nights of Danger, Mystery, Witching and the Chaos Moon (Alfred Nunez Jr.)

The Evolution of the Elf - Some Background to Help Roleplay (Tim Eccles)

My Skaven Campaign (Toby Pilling)

Remaindered (Tim Eccles)

Crossword Answers (Rich Pingree)

89690.name: Teddy Boy
89690.description:
Game Manual

Teddy Boy is a scrolling platform game where players take on the role of Teddy Boy, a character who is armed with a "Microgun". Monsters are initially located inside boxes with dice pips indicating how many are inside. Teddy must shrink the monsters with his microgun and step on them to score points and eliminate them.

89691.description:
(from MMP website:)

ASL Action Pack #7 carries on the tradition of supporting the best World War Two tactical boardgaming system with a package of three new geomorphic maps (boards 60, 61, and 62) and ten scenarios designed for use with the Advanced Squad Leader game system.

Scenario List:

AP63 The Nutcracker (German vs. Russian, Klin, Russia, 1941)
AP64 A Well-Engineered Ambush (British vs. German, Djefna, Tunisia, 1942)
AP65 Baw Drop (British vs. Japanese, Baw Village, Burma, 1943)
AP66 Cat’s Cradle (Russians vs. German, Cherkasskoye, Russia, 1943)
AP67 Cherry Ripe (German vs. British, Centuripe, Sicily, 1943)
AP68 Odd Angry Shot (Japanese vs. Australian, Finisterre Range, New Guinea, 1943)
AP69 Uncommon Misery (Japanese vs. British, Potsambang, Burma, 1944)
AP70 Sons of Slava (German vs. Russian, Busk Sasov, Poland, 1944)
AP71 Head In The Noose (American vs. German, near Arry, France, 1944)
AP72 Guns For St. Barbara (German vs. American, St. Barbara, Germany, 1944)
89691.name: ASL Action Pack #7

89692.name: LAXTime
89692.description:
From the publisher:

It's a race to be the first to assemble your winning lacrosse team. Collect your Attack Players, Midfield and Defense Line and a Goalie. Recruits and Substitutions are allowed but watch out for penalties! LaxTIME SportACTION Card Game is the next best thing to being on the field. It's fun for the entire family!

89693.name: Hockey Ice Dice Game
89693.description:
From the publisher:

A fun and easy hockey dice game in a mini hockey bag storage case ready for an 'off the ice' game anywhere and any time!

Includes four dice for offensive and defensive plays, rules and a scoresheet. Players roll the offensive dice to determine if a shot or penalty happens. The defensive player then rolls a defensive die to determine if the goalie makes a save or there is a score. Player with the most goals after 3 periods of play wins!

Game includes a small hockey bag for the storage of the game components.

89694.name: Beachopoly
89694.description:
This Monopoly variant was published as a fundraiser for the Taft High School (Lincoln City, OR) 2009 Senior Class. The board features local businesses from Otis, Neotsu, Lincoln City, Glenden Beach, Lincoln Beach, and Depoe Bay instead of the traditional properties.

Houses and Hotels are replaced with green and red 'customer' chips. Chance and Community Chest cards are renamed as Fate and Beachcombing cards. Other non-property spaces on the board are also renamed (Loading Zone instead of Free Parking, etc) and each feature the name and logo of a local business. Money features the Chinook Winds Casino Resort name and logo, playing pieces match the 'monopolist' pieces from Anti-Monopoly.

boardgameimplementation: Pirate Dice: Voyage on the Rolling Seas
boardgamehonor: 2011 Golden Geek Best Print & Play Board Game Nominee
2012 Golden Geek Best Print & Play Board Game Nominee
89695.description:
You are a bored supercomputer, and -- without anything better to do -- you and your fellow supercomputers are racing underling worker robots around the factory floor. You must program the robots with movement instructions in order to navigate them and be the first to make it back to the finish line.

Beware -- there are many hazards on the factory floor, not the least of which are your opponents! You will need more than pure speed as you use your wits to block, push, and zap your opponents (while doing your best to foil their attempts to do the same). As you take damage, it will become more difficult to pilot your robot. But never fear -- it’s your goal to claim victory at all costs!

This game seeks to be a slimmed down PnP version of RoboRally, craftable with a small set of sticker dice and playable with 2 players in under 45 minutes.

This game was designed by Clinton Herron (HanClinto) for the One Full-sheet Label PnP Contest.

Want to build it? The all-in-one thread to download files is here:
Consolidated File Information

Re-implemented as:

Pirate Dice: Voyage on the Rolling Seas
89695.name: RoboDerby: Express

89698.name: Deadlands Weird West Roleplaying Game Limited Leather Bound Edition
89698.description:
User Summary:

When Pinnacle released the second revised edition of Deadlands, in addition to the standard editions of the books, they also did a limited number of books containing Weird West Player's Guide and Marshal's Handbook bound together with a leather cover.

89701.name: Mind's Eye Theatre Discipline Deck
89701.description:
From the Back Card:

The Mind's Eye Theater [sic] Discipline Deck contains 150 cards detailing all of the powers from the Laws of the Night Second Edition. Each card contains a full write up on one of the powers from the game.

89702.name: RUSH
89702.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

From the twisted puzzle minds behind the award winning Toki Tori comes a new game, simply called RUSH.

Fortunately for fans of high quality puzzle games, RUSH is anything but simple. In the game’s fully three dimensional levels, players need to guide cubes to color coded exit points using Conveyor belts, Warps, Stops Signs, Splits and more!

The game can be easily controlled with just the mouse, allowing your brain to fully focus on the solutions!

Features

Unique 3D puzzle solving gameplay
Over 70 levels of increasing difficulty
Drag ‘n Drop control system
Use Conveyor Belts, Warps, Stop Signs, Splits and more
Hint system, when your brain needs a break
Regularly updated bonus levels
Highly stylized environments
Steam Achievements
Multiple profiles

89703.name: Islands Go Go Go
89703.description: The Game uses the map of Hong Kong Islands District as the background. Players discover the scenic spots of Hong Kong of Islands District and collect scoring points by using transportation card(s) according to the transportation type and number stated on the route. For example, the player uses 4 "Ferry" cards, the corresponding player marker on the map will move from Central to Cheung Chau and collect scoring card or bonus card on Cheung Chau. Each turn player either draw transportation card(s) or move the player marker around the map to score. A collection of location cards will also provide bonus points at the end of the game. The player with the highest score wins the game.

89704.name: Super Team Games
89704.description:
Super Team Games (Famitore Daiundōkai (ファミトレ大運動会?)) is a game that was also developed and published by Bandai. Super Team Games consisted of a group of different summer camp-style contests that utilized side B of the Power Pad/Family Trainer.

Source: Wikipedia, "Power Pad", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89705.name: Tanktics: Computer Game of Armored Combat on the Eastern Front
videogameversion: Atari 4/800 / Apple II / Pet 2001 / TRS-80 edition
89705.description:
From the back of the box:

6 September 1943: Following the debacle at Kursk, the German Army reels back to the protection of the Dneiper River. The Red Army pursues hard trying to turn a retreat into a rout. A Soviet armored unit breaks through the thin line and heads for a vital road junction, hoping to cut off the retreating German infantry. Your tiny panzer group is the only unit capable of stopping them. You are outnumbered two to one, but your orders are firm: stop the Soviet tanks. With grim determination your tired tankers head down the road for another desperate battle.

By Chris Crawford

89706.name: North Atlantic Convoy Raider
videogamehonor: 1980 Charles S. Roberts Best Computer Game Nominee
89706.description:
From the game manual's Introduction:

"This game pits the Bismarck against the British Home Fleet in a desperate attempt to bring England to her knees
by sinking merchant ships or by dealing a decisive blow to her Home Fleet. The action occurs during the spring of
1941 in, the North Atlantic Ocean.

"You are the Captain of the Bismarck; the computer handles the British Home Fleet, convoys, and airsearch. The game is played on a 12 x 12 grid representing a portion of the Atlantic Ocean. The object of the game for you is to sink as many British merchant ships and battleships as possible while bringing the Bismarck back to port. The object for the computer is to sink the Bismarck as quickly as possible or at least force it back to port before substantial damage can be done to the British forces."

Summary

Using a simple text-based map, the player moves the Bismarck across the North Atlantic in search of convoys to attack while trying to avoid the main forces of the Royal Navy. The game took into account the impact of weather changes and night time operations in a basic fashion, and combat was reported in simple lines of text. Written in BASIC, the game was designed by National Microcomputer Associates.

89707.name: Dark Sector
89707.description:
Back of case:

Become the ultimate weapon
The Virus. The source of your pain...
your enemy...Your POWER.
Unleash the deadly power of the glaive and become the hero.

89709.name: Far Cry Instincts Predator
89709.description:
Back Cover:
You are Jack Carver, a man in the wrong place at the wrong time. Currently being pursued by an elite force of mercenaries in a remote tropical island, you will have to put your survival skills and 'Predator Instincts' to the test to survive.

-With total freedom, devise your own methods of attack by land,sea or air: snipe from extreme distances, set up brutal traps and more...

-Overcome numerous enemies, including rebel pirates and feral warriors.

-Unleash your new and improved feral abilities and become the ultimate predator.

-Amazing Xbox Live features: 25 maps, 5 modes, unique map editor...

89710.name: Just Cause
videogamehonor: 2007 British Academy Game Awards Best Technical Direction of the Year Nominee
89710.description:
Back cover:
You are RICO RODRIGUEZ a top secret agent about to start a Revolution...

With 89 vehicles at your disposal choose from choppers, boats, cars, bikes, mini-subs and jets to explore 1,025Km2 of the tropical island of San Esperito.

Skydive, parasail, machine-gun, car-jack, basejump and bazooka your way through missions as you lead a nation to freedom.

89711.name: World series of Poker: Tournament of Champions
89711.description:
Back Cover:
-The most top pros ever in one game
-Learn insider tips & strategies from Chris "Jesus" Ferguson
-Top Poker locations:'The Rio suite hotel and casino'
Caesars palace and Many more!!

Texas Hold'em, High-Low, Omaha

89713.name: Over G Fighters
89713.description:
Back Cover:
Kick the tires and light the fires!
-Turn and burn in more than 30 of the most powerful military aircrafts
-Dogfight up to 8 pilots an Xbox live or fly more than 75 single-player mission.
-Track bogeys using a realistic HUD for each aircraft.
-Arm your aircraft with a wide range of lethal weaponry.

89714.name: Test Drive Unlimited
videogamehonor: 2006 Game Critics Best Racing Game of the Year Nominee
2007 D.I.C.E. Racing Game of the Year Nominee
89714.description:
Back Cover:

Racing reinvented

Test Drive Unlimited is more than a racing game.
It's a racing lifestyle offering a totally immersive offline and online world where you set the rules, the time and the place

Test Drive Unlimited is the ultimate automotive gaming experience!

89715.name: Rumble Roses XX
videogamefranchise: Platinum Collection (Best Selling Xbox 360 Games, JP)
89715.description:
Back Cover:
ALL-GIRL WRESTLING ACTION
-Career Mode -Xbox Live play -Custom character creation
-Realistically modelled female bodies -Skills and physiques develop depending on your style of play -Tag-team,street fighting,3-way battle royal, humiliation matches and much more

LET'S GRAPPLE!

videogame: Sly Cooper and the Thievius Raccoonus
89716.name: The Sly Collection
videogamecompilation: Sly Cooper and the Thievius Raccoonus
89716.description:
Back Cover

All three classic Playstation Sly Cooper games in HD and 3D on one Blu-Ray disc. Includes new Playstation Move minigames.

videogame: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time
Prince of Persia: The Two Thrones
89717.name: Prince of Persia Trilogy
videogameseries: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time
videogamecompilation: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time
Prince of Persia: The Two Thrones
89717.description:
Back Cover:
Defy the Course of Destiny
embark upon an epic journey to defy death and save the world from the ravages of the Sands of Time

-Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time
-Prince of Persia: The Warrior Within
-Prince of Persia: The Two Thrones

Remastered in High Definition

Play the games in 3D on a 3D enabled TV

89719.name: Excalibur (Volume 2, Issue 1 - Feb 1992)
rpgissuearticle: L'arma decisiva; La guerra dei cinque anni
Le cronache - Anno nuovo, cose nuove
Dol Amroth: la terra dei Principi
Dove nessun uomo è mai giunto prima
La fiera - Il mercatino di Avalon
89719.description:
User summary:

48 pages of text plus an adventure insert (16 pages). Contents:

articles for Middle-earth Role Playing and Call of Cthulhu
additional rules for Fantasy Warriors
two scenarios for Marc Miller's Imperium
a preview of the Italian edition of Cyberpunk 2020
a special feature on Star Trek
three adventures (CoC, MERP, Basic D&D)

89722.name: Lorraine '44: Liberez Metz, Thionville, Chateau Salins
89722.description:
A wargame in French published in 1982.

It's about the general Patton and the 3rd US army liberating Metz on the way to attack the Saarland.

It's a small scale little wargame with hex and counters. It's based on usual rules from that time: zones of control, communication lines, combat table based on attack vs defense ratio.
One hex is for 3 km - 2 miles.
The main goal is to cross the German defense - the west wall - behind the Saar river.

It was available in a ziplock bag.
The counters are mounted on a thin cardboard.
The map quality is good - but of course looking like other games from the 80s.

89723.name: Cultures 2: The Gates of Asgard
89723.description:
User summary:
