Cultures 2 is of course the second game in Cultures series. Gameplay stays the same, it's still a great city building game. In this one, you've got 11 missions while you are travelling from England to Baghdad because a dark prophecy interrupts life that the Vikings were living.

89725.name: Marooned
89725.description:
Here is a reading game that will take kids across the curriculum learning facts in Mathematics, Geography, Biology and Nutrition as they read and draw a conclusion from the information provided.

The setting is a deserted island that players were forced to crash land on when the plane's engine failed. In order to survive, players must roam the island in search of food, water and useful supplies. As they marooned survivors comb the beaches to meet their basic needs, they are collecting Survival Cards related to the 4 curriculums listed above.

When 3 cards in a category/curriculum have been collected, the player is awarded a Raft Card. Four Raft Cards are required to make the escape and win.

89727.name: Freelance Traveller (Issue 13 - Jan 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Fifth Imperium #15: Twenty Weeks of Traveller, Part One: Publisher Lessons Learned
In A Store Near You: NHR Multifunction Robot
In A Store Near You: Specialized Grenade Types
Raconteurs' Rest: A Passage to Extolay
The Shipyard: Vagrant-class X-boat Service Hull
Up Close and Personal: P. Hunley Marsters
89727.description:
From the Contents page:

Freelance Traveller #013: January 2011

Cover: Donovan Lambertus

Freelance Traveller is published monthly in PDF form by the editor. The current issue is available from the Freelance Traveller web site.

89728.name: Barrow Hill Curse of the Ancient Circle
89728.description:
Source: The Publisher Website.
Somewhere deep within the woods a timeless force is stirring. Beneath the ancient burial mound, known locally as Barrow Hill, a forgotten myth awakes.

Join the adventure, and uncover the secrets of the past. The legends of the Ancient world will live again; renewed, refreshed and hungry. Time has no meaning, as the sun sets low across the landscape.

Come to Barrow Hill and solve the mystery of the Druid's Circle.

Stranded on the lonely road, which leads up to the Barrow, you must make your way through the trees, and darkening landscape, and out onto the Barrow itself.

Following in the footsteps of the well-known archaeologist, Conrad Morse, you will discover that the barrow is more than just a mound of earth and a collection of forgotten standing stones.

However, not all archaeology is constructive, for some things should be left buried and undisturbed. Perhaps it is too late for that

User comments A old-style point-and-click mystery game with richly illustrated (although not quite photo-realistic) pre-rendered backgrounds and a strongly thematic (creepy...) soundtrack. Movement is orthogonal from one screen to another (you can move forward, or turn left & right, or zoom in/out on hotspots) The setting is the current day - or at least begins that way.

89730.name: Urban Runner
videogameversion: North American Windows edition (SierraOriginals budget release)
89730.description:
You are Max, an American journalist in Paris. There seems to be a story at hand, about a big drug dealer who is covered by some influential person in politics. To get the dealer talking, you offer him a photography in exchange for some information. But when you get there, the drug lord is dead and everyone's on your back - mistaking you for the killer.

The game itself is a movie adventure on four CD-ROMs, dividing gameplay in Clue- and Action-turns. You can control the game completely via mouse.
Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Urban_Runner,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89731.name: El cetro de Yarek
89731.description:
"El cetro de Yarek" ("Yarek's Sceptre") is a game of terror for players Ages 9 and up, and for 2 to 4 players. "El cetro de Yarek" was published in Spain at the end of the 1980's decade by the CEFA company specializing in party games with horror ambientation.

The game comes with:

- A 3D board game (including a thunder-roulette and two rotary discs)
- 4 magicians
- 4 plastic bases
- 24 magic cards
- 13 keys (9 false keys, 4 true keys)
- 1 sceptre with a gem

Theme. The four most famous magicians of the world (Mr. Drake, Vudu, Fu-Manchu, Houdini) struggle hard to get the Sceptre's Yarek. The holder of the Sceptre will become the most powerful magician in the world. However the Sceptre is hidden in a phantasmagoric ship crowded by zombies.

Game-play. "El cetro de Yarek" is basically a roll-and-move game. The game doesn't contain any dice because includes a thunder-roulette for the same purpose.In addition the boardgame includes some squares with events, cards or keys.

Goal. Getting the Sceptre first of all. But you'll need to arrive at the end with the true key.

89732.name: The Mystery Of The Druids
89732.description:
From the back of the box:

"In this classic adventure, you will take on the role of young Scotland Yard detective Brent Halligan, assigned to solving the puzzle surrounding a mysterious order of Druids and a series of gruesome murders. It appears that the neo-Druids are conducting ritual killings in order to conjure up incredibly sinister forces.

In the course of their investigations, the unsuspecting hero and his ally, a young scientist, delve into almost forgotten secrets of the past. Aided by an expert on Druid, they finally travel back in time.

Only in the distant past they will be able to find the key to saving the world but will they succeed?

FEATURES:

- More than 50 impressive locations of the past and present
- More than 360 interactive scenes
- Non-linear dialogues
- High resolution 2D / 3D graphics
- More than 20 characters to talk to
- 3D characters (up to 1000 polygons)
- Lip-sync dialogues created through phonetic speech analysis
- 5 hours of voice-overs
- Extensive real-time soundtrack
- Soundtrack and FX created with Dolby Surround"

89734.name: Hopkins FBI
videogameversion: Hopkins FBI CD-ROM PC English Version
89734.description:
From the back of the box:

"Special Agent Hopkins has just been put on the biggest case of his life: find and kill Bernie Berkson, the most vicious and dangerous criminal in years.

Hostage showdowns, murders, terrorist acts: Special Agent Hopkins has to get around a nightmare of traps and twisted surprises in the course of his investigations if he wants to find Berkson and save the planet from certain doomsday. Let's just say that if Quentin Tarantino had ever created video game, it would have been "Hopkins FBI".

You play Hopkins, modern day hero and full time righter-of-wrongs, in an adventure that will take you to the four corners of the world. A rich and varied universe awaits you, as you come face to face with over 50 characetrs, many dangerous, all one-of-a-kind. Try to keep cool as you strive to unlock challenge after challenge in face of ever-mounting suspence and action."

89735.name: Sargon III
89735.description:
Game Box

A Computer Chess Game with 9 levels of difficulty. Play with a friend, Set up new board configurations and have the program suggest a move. Changes sides with the computer mid-game and Save a game to disk.

89738.name: Sonic Gems Collection
89738.description:
Sonic Gems Collection is a compilation of some of the more obscure titles from the Sonic the Hedgehog video game series; Sonic CD, Sonic the Fighters and Sonic R. It also included the two Vectorman games and six Sonic-based Sega Game Gear titles (Sonic the Hedgehog 2, Sonic the Hedgehog Spinball, Sonic Drift 2, Sonic Triple Trouble, Tails Adventures, and Tails Sky Patrol), whilst the Japanese version also featured the Streets of Rage trilogy and Bonanza Bros.. It was released for the Nintendo GameCube and PlayStation 2 in Japan on August 11, 2005 and in Europe on September 30, 2005. In North America, only the GameCube version was released on August 16, 2005.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sonic Gems Collection", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89739.name: Touch Detective
89739.description:
User Summary

Mackenzie is a young girl who wants to join the famous Great Detective Society. In order to join, she must prove herself by solving 4 cases. She is aided by her ancient butler and pet mushroom.

The game was followed by a sequel: Touch Detective 2 1/2.

Made by BeeWorks.

89740.name: Bloody Good Time
89740.description:
The game is a spiritual sequel to The Ship, Outerlight's debut title, with same but tweaked gameplay and improved graphics. It features four various game modes (hunt, elimination, revenge and deathmatch). Up to eight players can play in online matches. There is also an arcade mode which allows the player to play againts the AI bots. The title utilizes Valve's Source engine.

The game takes place on a Hollywood movie set and it features three different maps: beach, casino and horror house. Players can choose one of the eight available B-movie characters (The Surfer, The Beach babe, The Goth, The Bunny girl, The Showgirl, The Clown, The Gambler and The Stoner) and then kill other players with 21 different weapons, including usual guns and other items, such as frying pan or remote-controlled rats.

Released on Xbox Live Arcade and PC.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bloody Good Time", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89741.name: Hector: Badge of Carnage Episode 1: We Negotiate with Terrorists
89741.description:
The first episode in a series of comedic adventure games for the iPhone and iPod Touch. Based on Hector: Fat Arse of the Law, a series of short animations by Straandlooper Animations.

When a hostage crisis erupts in the centre of Clappers Wreake, only one man has the diplomatic finesse to defuse a simmering situation before it boils over into a stew of butchery and bloodshed: Detective Inspector Hector. He’s all they’ve got. Literally. All the other negotiators are dead. Hector has a choice to make: carry out the terrorist’s curiously altruistic demands, or watch as his fellow officers are picked off one by one. Hector’s still on the fence.

Episodes 2 and 3 are currently in development.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hector: Badge of Carnage", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89742.name: Requiem - An RPG Geek Adventure Across Space and Time
89742.description:
Requiem is an interactive fiction adventure designed by Dave Bernazzani and Jaime Lawrence with the help of beta testers from RPG Geek. It requires a Z-Machine interpreter to play. People who completed this adventure before January 9th, 2011, were awarded an exclusive microbadge:

The date is January 1st, 2011. James Alden, time traveler and son of Board Game Geek founder Scott Alden, needs your help... to save the world! Something on The Geek triggered the war to end all wars on January 20th, 2011, and the last remaining survivors of Earth are struggling to stay alive in 2051. Using the powerful Orb of Alden, can you travel through time to stop humanity's impending doom?

89743.name: Rock Band Unplugged
89743.description:
User Summary:

A conversion of the "Rock Band" franchise to the Sony PSP, "Rock Band Unplugged" merged the music, concept & settings of Harmonix' Rock Band to their gameplay mechanics of "Amplitude".

Players have to hit controls in sequence to falling "notes", just like Rock Band/Guitar Hero et al, but at the same time, have to switch between different instruments as the song progresses, like Amplitude.

Strictly single player, the game builds upon the "World Tour" mode from Rock Band 2 & provides an in-game DLC store for music downloads via PSN.

89744.name: Virtua Tennis World Tour
videogamehonor: 2005 Game Critics Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
89744.description:
User Summary:

"Virtua Tennis World Tour" is a PSP only game, developed by Sumo Digital, that takes the Virtua Tennis arcade gameplay & gives it a single player overhaul, while making it portable friendly.

Notable as Sumo's first work on the franchise, World Tour sports a deep single player mode that takes the "World Tour" concept & adds a large amount of minigames & depth to the experience.

89745.name: Winter Voices: Those Who Have No Name
89745.description:
It's now time for a long journey, on a snowy trail, to the distant capital, from shelter to shelter. Travelling in the snow is an ordeal and strangers, tramps or travelers also caught up in this unexpected winter now replace the familiar faces of your childhood village. Haunted by ghosts in your past, to avoid giving up on the voyage and going back, you must find the courage to face your fears...

The game alternates real-time phases for dialog, world exploration and turn-based combat that requires reflection and strategy, with a choice of more than 100 skills for a unique confrontation with your destiny.

Source: The Game Website.

89746.name: Winter Voices: Nowhere of Me
89746.description:
You advance in your adventure alone in the middle of the tundra and attempt to follow a forgotten trail, marked by ruins of ancient stopovers and roaming animals. Your unconscious' voices are submitting you to harrowing internal battles, which you must overcome to carry on with your reconstruction. Your future takes shape as you battle your way through an inhumane nature. Will you be strong enough to face your demons, the fear of loneliness and the temptation of death?

The game alternates real-time phases for dialog, world exploration and turn-based combat that requires reflection and strategy, with a choice of more than 100 skills for a unique confrontation with your destiny.

Source: The Game Website.

89747.name: Escape to Wisconsin Trivia
89747.description: Escape to Wisconsin Trivia is a roll and move trivia game with many similarities to Trivial Pursuit. Players take turns moving their tokens around the board on a track that is shaped like the outline of the state of Wisconsin. Questions are color coded into five categories, each question having to do with some aspect of the history and culture of Wisconsin: Famous People, Sports/Recreation, Geography, History/Government, and Agriculture/Industry. The winner of the game is the player who is the first to collect a scoring piece from each of the five colors. Scoring pieces are obtained by landing on star spaces and correctly answering a question corresponding to the color of the space.

89750.name: Animal Shuffle
89750.description:
In Animal Shuffle, players are trying to gather a set of animal fluffy toys from a multiplayer claw catcher. On their turn, each player can move to one of a number of specified spaces on the 9x9 grid, so as to catch the hidden prize that lies there.

Players only know the color of their catch, and not its nature (rank). They can also only keep 6 prizes in their hand, so that they must choose which ones to keep to be able to build a valuable (poker-like) collection.

Each move must lead to a catch, and the game ends when a player can't make a legal move. The player with the best set in hand wins the game.

89752.name: Memory Reloaded: the downfall
89752.description:
Test your concentration with Memory Reloaded, a matching game for these unstable times. Step on to the battlefield of our collective memory and face all the semantic shifts, revisions, and manipulations that are rewriting our past. History may be different from that which you remember.

Source: The Game Website.

89753.name: Leaky World: a playable theory
89753.description:
Made in 10 days by Molleindustria as a contribution to the Wikileaks stories project.

Arrow keys to move. Space to cut the connections. Z to read the full news.

This game is an interactive interpretation of the essay "Conspiracy as Governance" by Julian Assange, a fundamental document to understand Wikileaks and the concept of radical transparency as strategy for social change. We published the text below, in its most recent version.

Leaky world includes headlines about actual information leaks, mostly but not esclusively related to Wikileaks. Clicking on the headline pauses the game and opens a browser window on a news article.

Source: The Game Website.

89754.name: Northland
89754.description:
User summary:
The third game in Cultures series.
After saving the world in Cultures 2: The Gates of Asgard, Vikings return home to find their land swamped with enemies.
In this one you get 8 campaign missions and also 8 other missions, that aren't part of the story.

89755.name: 8th Wonder of The World
89755.description:
User summary:
This is the fourth game in Cultures series where evil is spreading through the world and the only solution the Vikings see is to build 8 wonders of the world again. And while trading and really cooperating with other tribes wasn't so necessary in the first three parts of the series it is of most importance here, you can't complete some of the wonders without help from others.

89756.name: Star Wars Battlefront Renegade Squadron
89756.description:
User Summary:

"Renegade Squadron" is a Sony PSP exclusive title in the Star Wars Battlefront series. Developed by Renegade, this game focuses on a squad of rebel soldiers, led by Han Solo, with a single player campaign telling their story. Players can select different classes of characters & customize their look & weapon layouts.

Additionally, the game features the multiplayer modes the series is known for, with options for ad hoc or infrastructure mode gameplay up to 16 players.

89757.name: OutRun 2006: Coast 2 Coast
89757.description:
User Summary:

OutRun 2006: Coast 2 Coast took the classic OutRun arcade gameplay & structure, but updated it with a modern look & more of a single player gameplay structure.

Developed by Sumo Digital, the game retained the music & levels of the original game, but added a whole new single player mode featuring different game modes/styles of racing/minigames that earned the player "miles" to unlock new cars, music etc. Additional game modes matched the arcade game structure.

89758.name: Alien Syndrome
89758.description:
User Summary:

Taking its name & inspiration from the classic arcade shooter, "Alien Syndrome" attempts to recreate its Alien inspired atmosphere in another top down shooter with the player running around shooting tons of aliens while attempting to figure out what happened at the deserted colony.

89760.name: Almanach Superbohaterów
89760.description:
user summary

This is basicaly Super Powers Companion Explorer's Edition but translated to polish and some changes in content + B/W instead of full color + different layout and images.

The Limited Edition differs only slightly on the back cover + was accompanied with additional materials in PDF format (the PDF version of this book included as a bundle with limited edition!).

89761.name: Compacts & Conspiracies
89761.description:
From back cover:

For many hunters carrying the Vigil, the hunt is only one part of their lives. Many belong to hunter organizations -the more localized compacts, or the globe-spanning conspiracies.
Joining such a group comes with varying advantages-safety in numbers, a paycheck, access to unique weapons and critical information, and camaraderie. But it also comes replete with new problems: competition, cover-ups, and a rigorous set of rules to which one must adhere or face the always-unpleasant consequences. This book seeks to detail what life is like inside one of these organizations. What’s it like to belong to such a group? How does one get recruited? What does it take to advance - what sacrifices must be made?

89763.description:
The Dutch game association Ducosim publishes the game magazine Spel!. With this magazine they will publish several 'Spel!enkaarten' (gamecards). These are games which fit on a A5 card. #0004 is 'Survival' and was included with Spel! 14.2 December 2010

In this game one player controls 6 wolves, and the other player controls 1 reindeer. The wolves try to surround the reindeer in such a way that it cannot move in any direction. The reindeer tries to escape the wolves and run towards the safety of the forest.

The reindeer moves in random directions, but the player can decide how far the reindeer moves in the given direction. The wolves are restricted to one square either horizontal or diagonal.
89763.name: Survival

89764.name: Jets
89764.description:
Jets is a science fiction racing game that does not use a game board, instead you play on a very large surface (for instance your carpet). Each player receives one jet-racer. Your jet is moved by placing a distance token which varies in length according to your set speed in front of your jet.

Cards are supplied to improve the special abilities of your personal jet.

89765.name: La Vuelta al Mundo
89765.description:
A family travel game around the world. Players have to visit 6 mandatory cities plus some secondary ones. The first player to arrive in each of the mandatory cities must wait two turns, the rest of the players don't but have to visit some of the secondary cities related to that mandatory one (for example La Havana is the first secondary city of New York).
There are 3 means of transportation:
-road, the player always move but very slowly
-boat, must roll 3+ with a dice
-plane, must roll 6+ with two dice, but each move is further.

When all players have visited all mandatory cities, they must return to their start city in Spain.
The cities give points to the player (mandatory cities more, secondary less). At the end the player with the most points win the game.

89766.name: Ultimate Movie Quiz
89766.description:
Ultimate Movie Quiz contains everything necessary to run a movie quiz game show. With 50 question cards containing 1900 questions and answers, answer sheets, and an audio CD, two or more players can test their film knowledge in 10 categories.

From the box:

Even better than a night at the Oscars, this ultimate quiz night will put any movie buff to the test!

How much do you really know about the movies? Find out with 10 categories titled: Hollywood Blockbusters, Movie History, Thriller and Horror Movies, Oscar Winners, Science Fiction Movies, Actors and Actresses, Directors, Movie Charades, Cult Movies, Movie Soundtracks and Famous Lines (on audio CD).

89767.description:
Translation of publisher's description

Off the Dead
Chapter 1: Death in Venice Beach

A deadly virus has spread across the world, only leaving behind decomposing corpses, animated by an irrepressible desire for fresh meat. Everywhere, members of the population spared by the epidemic group together to fight against the plague and increase their thin chances of survival against the hordes of undead.

With Off the Dead, play as one of these survivors facing the zombie invasion. Search rubble, organize your defense, eliminate zombies and abobe all, do not leave your companions behind, because once infected they may well join the ranks of the enemy.

In a world inspired the greatest genre films, Off the Dead mixes shivers, cooperation and individual strategy, altogether in a deliciously crazy atmosphere.

Box Contents:
87 cards including: 5 survivors, 36 rubble, 36 zombies, 5 zombified survivors, 4 infection tokens, 5 game aids, 1 die, 1 rulebook.

Mechanics:
The goal of the game is simply to kill all the zombies that are drawn from the deck and lose as least human players as possible.
Each player plays as follows during his turn :
1. Action #1 (attack a Zed, search for an item OR give an item to another player).
2. Zed action (they are generated, they advance and infect player).
3. Action #2.
4. Infection (counter incrementation : after 4 steps, player is out).
Player attacks are solved by a die roll with weapon modifier.
89767.name: Off the Dead: Chapitre 1 – Morts à Venice Beach
boardgameexpansion: Off the Dead: Chapitre 1 – Morts à Venice Beach – Promo Zombie
Off the Dead: Chapitre 2 – Venice Beach brûle-t-il?
Off the Dead: Chapitre 2 – Venice Beach brûle-t-il? – Promo Zombies
Off the Dead: Der Adler – Spiel Essen 2013 Promo

89768.name: Ultimate Music Quiz
89768.description:
Ultimate Music Quiz contains everything you need to run a music quiz night. With 50 question cards containing 1900 questions and answers with an included audio CD, two or more people can test their music knowledge in 10 different categories.

From the box:

This chart-topping quiz is packed full of fascinating questions guaranteed to keep everyone thinking until the end of the night.

Your knowledge will be pushed to the limits by 10 categories titled: Pop Music, 1960's and 1970's, 1980's and 1990's, Name That Song (on audio CD), Music and the Movies, Music Charades, One Hit Wonders, Albums and Singles, What's in a Name?, General Music Trivia.

89769.name: Stalker
rpghonor: 2012 Indie RPG Award - Best Production - Runner-Up
89769.description:
Publisher blurb:

STALKER is a Finnish science fiction roleplaying game based on the novel of Russian writers Arkadi and Boris Strugatsky. Event called the Visitation, perhaps by alien visitors to Earth, has left behind six locations thrown in to chaos. In these prohibited zones, or simply "Zones", laws of nature have turned against themself and all life has either been destroyed or hideously distorted. Stalkers are adventurers and criminals living outside the society who are looking the remnants and technology of the alien civilization. Everybody needs them, even those who are responsible for guarding the Zones, because stalkers have gone farther in the zones than anyone else.

89770.name: Praedor (1.1 edition)
rpgissuearticle: Antakaa minulle kirves ja vihollinen johon sen voi löydä!
89770.description:
From the publisher page:

PRAEDOR is a fantasy roleplaying game based on the comic book stories of Petri Hiltunen. It tells about Jaconia, fragment of a world, left in the middle of the ruins of a super-culture, devastated by an ancient curse. It tells about praedors, talented and courageous adventurers, who make trips to the ruins of Borvaria in hope of treasures. They are the heroes and villains of legends, envied and hated upstarts. Among them, high and low are equal, because monsters and demons don't care about family trees.

89771.name: Hacker Evolution
89771.description:
From the Publisher / Developer Website

Hacker Evolution is a new hacking simulation game, featuring unparalleled graphics and features.
You play the role of a former intelligence agent, specializing in computer security. When a chain of events sets off worldwide, leaving critical service disabled, you assume the role a computer hacker to find out what happened and attempt to stop it.
When a stock market, a central bank, satellite uplink and transoceanic fiber optics links crash, you know this is more then a simple event. Something big is behind all this, and you have to figure out what is it.
You hack into computers, look for exploits and information, steal money to buy hardware upgrades in an attempt to put all the pieces of a big puzzle, together.

Set in a virtual operating system environment, the game is packed with all the features required to bring the hacker feeling and experience to every gamer.

The concept behind Hacker Evolution is to create a game that challenges the gamer's intelligence, attention and focus, creating a captivating mind game. Solve puzzles, examine code and bits of information, to help you achieve your objectives.

89774.name: Space Bust-a-Move
89774.description:
User Summary

The second DS-exclusive game in the Bust-a-Move/Puzzle Bobble series. This time it's set in space and has online play via the Nintendo Wi-Fi Connection.

Unlike Bust-a-Move DS, this game does not feature touchscreen controls.

By Lancarse.

89775.name: Worms: Open Warfare
89775.description:
User Summary

Worms: Open Warfare is the first handheld Worms game and the first game to return to the series' 2D roots. Released for both DS and PSP.

Spawned a sequel.

89776.name: Peggle Nights
89776.description:
User Summary

Sequel to PopCap's popular Peggle. Originally released for Windows and MacOS.

Peggle Nights was released as DLC for the original Peggle on Xbox Live Arcade.

Most of Peggle Nights can be unlocked in the Nintendo DS exclusive Peggle: Dual Shot.

Peggle Nights content can also be purchased for the iPhone Peggle game.

89777.name: Space Invaders Extreme 2
89777.description:
User Summary

This sequel to Space Invaders Extreme plays similarly to its predecessor but contains some new game modes, new difficulty levels, and some tweaks to features like Fever Mode.

89778.name: The Tales of Bearsworth Manor: Chaotic Conflicts
89778.description:
User Summary

Released on the same day as its sister game, Tales of Bearsworth Manor: Puzzling Pages is a WiiWare-exclusive Square-Enix endeavor.

The story in both games revolves around creepy ghost children and their magical books. Entering the book starts the game.

The main mechanic in both games is using the Wiimote to toss bears at the screen. In Chaotic Conflicts, this takes the form of a tower defense game where players must throw bears at the screen to protect gems from incoming enemy units.

89779.name: Tales of Bearsworth Manor: Puzzling Pages
89779.description:
User Summary

Released on the same day as its sister game, Tales of Bearsworth Manor: Chaotic Conflicts is a WiiWare-exclusive Square-Enix endeavor.

The story in both games revolves around creepy ghost children and their magical books. Entering the book starts the game.

The main mechanic in both games is using the Wiimote to toss bears at the screen. In Puzzling Pages, this takes the form of a puzzle game where players must throw bears at precise areas of the screen to avoid obstacles and collect gems.

89781.name: Zuma's Revenge!
89781.description:
User Summary

Sequel to the original Zuma. Includes new power-ups, levels, and features such as boss battles. Also marks the first entry of the series to be made in HD.

89782.name: Birds & Beans
89782.description:
User Summary

Birds & Beans is a DSiWare compilation title that includes both Pyoro and Pyoro 2 unlockable mini-games from the original WarioWare for GBA.

videogame: Space Quest Chapter 1: The Sarien Encounter
Space Quest III: The Pirates of Pestulon
Space Quest IV: Roger Wilco and the Time Rippers
Space Quest V: The Next Mutation
89783.name: Space Quest Collection
videogamecompilation: Space Quest Chapter 1: The Sarien Encounter
Space Quest III: The Pirates of Pestulon
Space Quest IV: Roger Wilco and the Time Rippers
Space Quest V: The Next Mutation
89783.description:
User Summary
A compilation of all six Space Quest games.

videogame: Ninja Gaiden II: The Dark Sword of Chaos
Ninja Gaiden III: The Ancient Ship of Doom
89784.name: Ninja Gaiden Trilogy
videogamecompilation: Ninja Gaiden II: The Dark Sword of Chaos
Ninja Gaiden III: The Ancient Ship of Doom
89784.description:
Ninja Gaiden Trilogy (忍者龍剣伝 巴 Ninja Ryūkenden Tomoe) is a 1995 SNES collection featuring all three [original Ninja Gaiden] games. Few improvements were made, but passwords were included and the cinematic sequences were improved. The graphics were retouched and the soundtrack was updated. The third game was also made more playable by reverting the difficulty level to that of the Japanese version, with infinite continues and more reasonable damage from enemy attacks. Unfortunately, the ports suffered from slowdown, unresponsive controls and no closing credits. Some graphical changes were made that removed parallax scrolling from the backgrounds of the levels. Other graphical changes were made to comply with Nintendo's "Family Friendly" censorship policy at the time (i.e. a pool of blood changed from red to green, and the removal of pentagrams)...

Source: Wikipedia, "Ninja Gaiden", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89785.name: RuneQuest: Gamemaster's Box
rpgissuearticle: A Runequest III Mini Scenario: The Visitors
89785.description:
From the back of the box:

This box includes:
Creatures Book (over 90 different creatures, including seven possible player types)
Gamemasters Book (civilization, gamemaster instructions, treasure, ships, two scenarios, encounter charts)
Introduction to Glorantha (dragonewts and chaos creatures, common knowledge, cult of Ernalda)
Pullouts (Quick References)
Character & Adventure Sheets (for immediate use)
MAP: Full color map of Fantasy Europe


Learn what gamemasters do.
Over 90 different creature species.
Ship rules, including 14 ship types.
Encounter Charts for mundane, magical, and spirit planes.
Gems, Jewelry, Magic Items, and other Treasures.
Price Lists for four types of market.
Economic System, including standards of living and wages.
Prepared Scenario: The Money Tree

89786.name: Raiden Fighters Aces
89786.description:
User Summary
The First and Last Word in Action.
The legendary Raiden Fighters series has finally arrived on the Xbox 360. All three games have been authentically recreated for this collection, and enhanced with new features.

Compete in a world-wide high-score competition over Xbox LIVE. Record and trade clips of gameplay online. Watch how the best players move and learn their secrets.

videogame: Sega Superstars Tennis / XBox Live Arcade Compilation
89787.name: XBox Live Arcade Compilation
videogamecompilation: Sega Superstars Tennis / XBox Live Arcade Compilation
89787.description:
User Summary:

Packed in with certain XBox 360 Arcades, this disc bundles various Xbox Live Arcade games & demos.

89788.name: Iron Grip: Warlord
89788.description:
on developer's website

Grab your weapons and head to the battlefield in the debut commercial game from Isotx, Iron Grip: Warlord!

Boasting both cooperative and single player game modes, a rich and original steam punk universe, and an innovative blend of RTS/FPS gameplay, Warlord gives you and fellow players a different experience from most titles out right now. Experience the intense combat of total war in the crumbling nation of Atelia. Whether you're fighting alone or with your friends, the odds are stacked against you as hundreds of Confederates swarm your base. Do you have what it takes to be a Warlord? Download the free demo and find out today!


* Cooperative multiplayer or singleplayer modes
* Up to 8 players supported at a time
* 7 engaging maps with more to come
* Hundreds of enemies at a time from all directions
* Various difficulty levels bring endless replayability and challenge
* An original soundtrack to enhance the mood of gameplay
* Frequent patches that include free downloadable content

System Requirements

Processor: Athlon XP 2000+, Pentium 4 2.0 GHz
Operating Systems: Windows 2000/XP/Vista
RAM: 512 MB RAM (1024 MB RAM Recommended)
Free Space: 450 MB hard disk space
Graphics: OpenGL compatible 128 MB video card (FX 5200 or Radeon 8500 or better)
Internet Connection: Internet connection required for registration and online play

89790.name: Cause of Death
89790.description:
Iphone Application that lets you solve the crime in a FREE NEW EPISODE EVERY WEEK. But be careful out there. Every choice you make could have deadly consequences.

In Volume One, play as Detective Mal Fallon and Special Agent Natara Williams on the trail of a terrifying killer known as "The Maskmaker." Gather evidence, ask hard questions, and make smart decisions... or else. From the shocking opening, the storyline grips you and doesn't let go. Chapter by chapter the plot unfolds. It's a virtual page turner! But remember, how the case ends depends on the choices YOU make. You'll find out who did it... or you might be done in yourself. Play again and again to see all the twists and turns the investigation can take.

Just like your favorite TV show, You can "tune in" each week for all-new cases to crack at no cost.


From EA Mobile's website

89791.name: Bontãgo
videogamehonor: 2004 IGF Awards Excellence in Design Winner
2004 IGF Awards Seumas McNally Grand Prize Nominee
89791.description:
User Summary

Bontago puts players head to head in a battle for control. Players gain influence over a map by stacking blocks. The higher the tower, the more your influence spreads. There are normal blocks and special attack blocks that help you knock over opponents' towers. The game world uses realistic physics for stacking.

89792.name: Cardstock Miniatures: Giants – Large and In Charge
89792.description:
Publisher blurb:

This collection of cardstock miniatures showcases over 45 monsters that are size Large or bigger! Since they're cardstock miniatures you can print out as many as you need for your game tonight! From the cyclops champion to the two-headed western forest giant, you're sure to find something to crush your players.

89794.name: Romance of the Three Kingdoms VI
89794.description:
User Summary:

Romance of the Three Kingdoms VI is the 6th installation of the successful and still ongoing Romance of the Three Kingdoms series by Koei.

Romance of the Three Kingdoms VI is a multiplayer game, able to take up to 8 players. Players take on roles of a ruler/warlord and manage their respective territories. This includes recruiting officers, improving agriculture and economy, drafting and training armies, maintaining diplomatic relations with other rulers and waging war. The ultimate goal of the game is to reunify China.

There are a few discerning features that depart from the past five editions:

i) Each general has a main goal/ambition in life. If assigned to tasks that are not in line with these goals, their loyalty will decrease.

ii) Each general possess a set of battle skills. Dueling now involves picking the correct skills to use during the 5 rounds of a duel. The War statistic still plays a crucial role in the duel, i.e. success and damage of the battle skills is related to it.

iii) There are different types of troops to recruit, depending on the location of the fortress. These troop types excel on different types of terrain.

89795.name: Outpost Gemini
89795.description:
Players are competing for customers who arrive in a known order, but who have different demands. Do you put your precious resources up for grabs to lure customers, or do you spend them on additional docking bays? Be wary of the government officials who aren't picky about what they take from you and only give you half as many points!

Components, rules, and example of play are available in the Files section.

89797.name: Austria Quiz
89797.description: A simple quiz card game with 107 cards. Each card covers a specific topic about Austria with 4 questions, the first being the easiest and the last the hardest. Players try to answer the questions and score points according to the chosen difficulty.

89798.name: Robinson's Requiem
89798.description:
From Wikipedia:

Robinson's Requiem is a 1994 survival simulation game developed by Silmarils and published by ReadySoft. Players assume the role of Officer Trepliev, a member of the fictional Alien World Exploration (AWE) department, whose spacecraft is sabotaged to crash land on a prison planet called Zarathustra.

Following this, the player must explore and survive in the hostile alien environment, while using the game's systems to monitor the player character's health status, perform surgery and create makeshift tools.

Rich Pelley of Amiga Power found the game to be extremely boring; he likened playing it to "being told to paint a fence and [...] discover[ing that] it's fifteen miles long". He also criticized its graphics and performance, and noted that the game's survival systems amounted to "lots of bars and charts and electrocardiograms, and not much action". The game also received poor reviews from both PC Gamer UK and PC Gamer US, who found the game frustrating and uninviting, and criticized its graphics.

Source: Wikipedia, "Robinson's Requiem", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89800.name: Mutant Penguins
89800.description:
Back of Box

Eradicate Mutant Penguins at all costs!

Unfortunately, they are really tough nuts to crack and have a vicious streak running through the that threatens the peaceful tranquility of your world.

Pit your wits against the marauding penguins in this humourous arcade strategy game as you battle to prevent them from activating their lethal Doomscale - the ultimate weapon of destruction.

89801.description:
The boy is a sly creature by all accounts, and he has a servant who is almost as cruel as he is. Reek, they call the man. They hunt together, the Bastard and this Reek, and not for deer. I’ve heard tales, things I can scarce believe, even of a Bolton.
--Lady Hornwood

Dreadfort Betrayal is the sixth monthly installment of 60 fixed cards --3 copies each of 20 different cards-- for the Brotherhood Without Banners expansion to A Game of Thrones: The Card Game. The never-before-seen cards in this expansion were designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the A Game of Thrones metagame.

A Game of Thrones LCG core set is required to play. Contains cards 101-120 of the Brotherhood Without Banners cycle.
89801.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Dreadfort Betrayal
boardgameexpansion: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game
boardgamefamily: A Song of Ice and Fire

89802.description:
Oldtown. It is the oldest city in Westeros, and home to the Citadel, a vast center of learning that is headquarters to the maester organization. Here these educated men forge their chains of mastery and servitude, committing their minds to knowledge, and their service to the realm.

Gates of the Citadel is the first monthly installment of 60 fixed cards--3 copies each of 20 different cards--for the Secrets of Oldtown expansion to A Game of Thrones: The Card Game. The never before-seen cards in this expansion were designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the A Game of Thrones metagame.

The A Game of Thrones LCG core set is required to play. Contains cards 1-20 of the Secrets of Oldtown cycle.
89802.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Gates of the Citadel
boardgameexpansion: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game
boardgamefamily: A Song of Ice and Fire

89803.name: Infinite Futures Corebook
89803.description:
From the Publisher:

Infinite Futures is a Pathfinder compatible Sci-Fi RPG geared to allow you to play any sort of Sci-Fi genre or game. Fully compatible with Pathfinder, you will find that IF is a great game, fully detailed with a loads of great races and classes as wells as skills and feats to make any Sci-Fi game a joy to play.

89804.name: Investimento: o Jogo da Vida
89804.description:
"Investimento" is a economic board game in which players invest in various businesses, trying to increase their profits, protect their money from inflation (which halves money in hand of players twice in a play), and, at the end of game, get more money than others players to win.

From publisher: "The game develops the minds of the participants, giving them ideas on how to invest well. The players are introduced to the financial, commercial and industrial environment. The goal of each player is invest all his gained money, exploit the acquired businesses, increase them and try to join in profitable partnerships."

Basically, it's a improved "Monopoly", with some concepts of business world.

89805.name: Przydatnik
89805.description:
Publisher's blurb in Polish:

Wolsungowy Przydatnik to dwa mini-dodatki, wydrukowane w poręcznym formacie kart do gry.

Więcej na www.wolsung.pl.
W pudełku znajdują się 22 dwustronnie zadrukowane karty, a na nich:

- Pomoce dla graczy i mistrzów gry: karty archetypów, podsumowanie zasad testów i konfrontacji, oraz listy akcji i manewrów specjalnych.
- Błyskawiczny Generator Scenariuszy Nadzwyczajnych: ostatnia deska ratunku przed niespodziewaną sesją.

and the English translation:

Wolsung's Przydatnik (sort of "Useful-thing") consists oftwo mini-expansions released in a handy format of a deck of cards.

More on http://wolsung.pl.

In the box there are 22 double-sided cards and on them:

- For players and game masters: cards of archetypes, summarizing the rules for tests and conflicts and a list of actions and special maneuvers.
- Instant Generator of Extraordinary Scenarios: GM's last hope before an unexpected adventure.

89806.name: Robotica
89806.description:
Part of publisher's blurb:
Apokaliptyczna gra fabularna w konwencji Science Fiction
Rozwijająca wyobraźnię gra fabularna opowiadająca o losach ocalałych śmiertelników oraz samoświadomych maszyn w dalekiej przyszłości, w trakcie trwającego armagedonu. Idealny prezent dla każdego fana fantastyki, science fiction i klimatów postapokaliptycznych.

Akcja gry toczy się w odległej, mocno skomputeryzowanej rzeczywistości, przeplatającej się z nałożoną nań cyberprzestrzenią. Gracze wcielają się w postaci samoświadomych robotów, cyborgów, mutantów, androidów, wyswobodzonych klonów korporacyjnych, Hiperistoty.
Dzięki podziałowi na różne poziomy trudności i 3 warstwy zasad, ROBOTICA jest idealną grą zarówno dla osób początkujących, a nawet ludzi, którzy dotychczas nie grali w gry fabularne, jak również dla zaawansowanych graczy, którzy najpewniej od razu zechcą poznać bardziej zaawansowane zasady.

and translation:

Apocalyptic science fiction role-playing game.
Developing the imagination of role-playing game that tells us about the fate of mortals and the survivors of self-aware machines in the distant future, during an armageddon. The ideal gift for any fan of fantasy, science fiction and post-apocalyptic genres.
The game is set in a remote, heavily computerized where reality become intertwined with superimposed upon it cyberspace. Players take the form of self-aware robots, cyborgs, mutants, androids, freed corporate clones and hyper-beings.

With the division into different levels of difficulty and 3 layers of rules, Robotica is the perfect game for both beginners and even those who have not yet played a role-playing games, as well as for advanced players who would probably want to know right away the more advanced rules.

89807.name: Bradley's D-Day
89807.description:
Bradley’s D-Day, is the third game in the Campaign Study Series. It is a two-player tactical/operational simulation of the combat action on the American Sector during the first two days of the Normandy invasion, 6-7 June 1944. The game looks at the American efforts all along the right flank of the Normandy landings. While Utah seemed relatively easy, it was there, at Omaha Beach, where the Germans came closest to derailing the greatest sea-borne invasion of all time. Behind both beaches, two famous airborne divisions were scattered all over the countryside, and fought by twos and twenties to accomplish a semblance of their missions. Call it the “Longest Two Days,” because that is the time-period covered in the game. Forty-eight hours of some of the most critical action in American history.

The key units are all here, including engineers with special abilities, DD-tanks, parachute and glider landings, and even railroad coastal artillery. One defining feature of the game is unit deployment; a unit can be deployed in one of two modes: Movement Mode allows for the greatest movement but the weakest combat (which is not to say those units can’t fight) and Combat Mode, which allows the strongest fighting abilities (but still some movement for most units).

"Bradley’s D-Day" offers an intriguing scale, a moderate level of complexity, and an ease of play that will make this game either a fine addition to your Overlord collection, or a good first start for those who have not already focused on this campaign.

Game Scale:
Turn: 2 hours of daylight or 4 hours or nightime
Hex 800 meters
Units: Company/Battalion

Game Equipment
One 22" x 34" full color map
Two counter sheets (320 1/2" counters)
One 20 page rule book
One Terrain Effects Chart
No dice (game owners need to supply two six-sided die)

89808.name: Invisibility
89808.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Behind the Spells pdf series continues with the invisibility spell! This series examines those spells from the SRD that are listed time and again on character sheets throughout gaming.

These are the spells which, if on your PC's class list, will be taken as soon as possible and include such quintessential favorites as magic missile and fireball. Each pdf in this series examines the spellcaster who created the spell, one or more of the spell's hidden capabilities, and possible variants for the spell.

Includes two invisibility variants!

89828.name: Wish & Limited Wish
89828.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Behind the Spells pdf series continues with two popular spells, wish and limited wish! This series examines those spells from the SRD that are listed time and again on character sheets throughout gaming.

These are the spells which, if on your PC's class list, will be taken as soon as possible and include such quintessential favorites as magic missile and fireball. Each pdf in this series examines the spellcaster who created the spell, one or more of the spell's hidden capabilities, and possible variants for the spell.

Includes one wish variant and a new magic item!

89829.name: Sol Negro
videogameversion: Spanish Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
89829.description:
User Summary

Bully and Monica are victims of an ancient curse. Each full moon one of them is turned into an animal (Monica to a hawk, Bully to a fish) and the other is reverts to human. Their only chance to break the curse is to reach the Temple of the Sun in the sunken city of Hidrionis in time for the next solar eclipse.

Like other Opera Soft games, Sol Negra is a side-scrolling action game split in two parts, the second part being accessible with a code given at the end of the first one. The first part has the player as Bully try to locate the key to the cage holding Monica in her hawk form. Once she's freed, the two must travel to the entrance of Hidrionis. The second part takes place underwater, as Monica tries to reach the entrance of the Temple while protecting Bully in fish form.

89830.name: Cray 5
89830.description:
User Summary

The space colonists are in mortal danger: the super-computer Cray 5 has suffered a malfunction after a collision with a meteorite and is shutting down the atmospheric processors. Only you can enter the administration complex, fight off the hordes of robotic guards, find the switches powering Cray 5 and shut them all down.

Cray 5 is a side-view action game. The player controls a colonist armed with a laser and using a jetpack to move around the different screens. In addition to the many enemies and traps, there are locked doors which can be opened by specific keys. Since only one key can be carried at a time, the player must carefully manage her use of keys, as well as keep an eye on the timer. There are also energy station to heal the characters and teleporters to move from an area to another.

89831.name: N.O.M.A.D.
89831.description:
User Summary

The evil Cyrus T. Gross safely rules his intergalactic crime network from the man-made asteroid Talos. No law enforcement agency has ever succeeded in bringing him to justice. You're the last of hope of the Free Worlds to get rid of Cyrus: a battle-hardened veteran of the Nemesis organisation. Your mission, fly the N.O.M.A.D. 471 attack droid to Talos and destroy the threat forever.

N.O.M.A.D. is a top-down view action game. The player pilots the combat droid, using the left and right keys to control the ship's facing and the forward and back keys to choose the direction of thrust (a joystick can also be used). The player must travel through screen after screen of enemies and traps. Some areas have doors that are unlocked by a nearby lever. Some areas also change the inertia of the ship, making these screens harder to navigate.

89832.name: Filmspel
89832.description:
This game is a film quiz published by Fantoom Projecten in collaboration with the International Film Festival Rotterdam (IFFR). The game contains a game board, 792 questions in 6 categories and hosts 2 to 5 players.
The object of the game is to answer questions right from each of the 6 categories, after which one final 'super' question has to be correctly answered.
The 6 categories are: Movie History, Directors, Movie Stars, General, Tiger Questions (related to the film festival) and Brain Teasers.
Players take turns, rolling dice and walking across a Trivial Pursuit-like game board on which the categories are represented. In addition, the board contains other icons that help you move across the board faster.

89833.name: APBA Soccer
89833.description:
APBA Soccer comes with 4 classic European teams to choose from. These legendary artists of the pitch will allow you to enjoy the thrill of Futbol the way it was meant to be. From the coaches perspective you manage your team and set the strategy to put them in position and lead them to victory!

APBA Soccer is a great game to enjoy a quick match or to learn the different facets and strategy of the worlds favorite pastime. Oh - did we mention that APBA Soccer is realistic and accurate as well? APBA Soccer is not a play-by-play simulation to allow for speed and enjoyable game play. We have included all the intricacies of soccer and still allow you to complete a full game in less than an hour!

APBA Soccer includes a number of optional rules which give you more involvement in the game. The more you choose to incorporate, the more control you have over the game! It's your game, It's your choice, play how you want to.

Enjoy International teams, European league teams, or American teams! Historical and current teams are available! Mix and match and pit your favorites against any foe you desire. So get your kicks on our pitch, with APBA Soccer!

89834.name: Clash of Arms: Cavalry
89834.description:
From publisher blurb:

Clash of Arms: Cavalry is a sourcebook that brings a historical flavor to your fantasy games. This supplement presents a new core class, the Cavalryman and then details the evolution of cavalry warfare through the ancient, classical and medieval periods. The necessary equipment to control a mount in battle is detailed, including the chariot, the bridle, saddle, stirrup and spurs, along with notes on when each piece of equipment appeared and the function of each to the mounted warrior. Finally, rules on generating new horse breeds are given so that each horse can be as individual as the man who rides him into battle.

89835.name: Clash of Arms: Infantry
89835.description:
From publisher blurb:

Clash of Arms: Infantry is the fifth installing in Vigilance Press’ historical-fantasy line of sourcebooks.

This book takes a long overdue look at the unsung heroes of every army of the Middle Ages: the common foot soldier, who was often not quite so common. These soldiers did the hard work, enduring attacks and sucking it up on the front lines while the cavalry and archery forces they protected reaped the lion’s share of the glory.

Still, any commander worth his salt understood the value of these forces and knew that, when used effectively, a force comprised of archers, spearmen and cavalry was unbeatable.

First, as with all the books in this line, we present a new, historically themed core class: the Infantryman. Like other classes in the series, this core class is designed for maximum flexibility, with numerous options for developing your character without forcing you to multi-class between a number of similar, very narrow classes.

Second, a new craft skill is presented, giving you the tools to remake the battlefield in your favor. Take away your enemy’s mobility and a small force of disciplined foot soldiers can defeat a much larger force, as witnessed by Henry V’s stunning victory at the Battle of Agincourt.

And speaking of Agincourt, we follow up the crunch with a description of three pivotal battles from history where foot soldiers proved their worth and helped carry the day: the Battle of Hastings, the Battle of Arsuf and finally the Battle of Agincourt.

89836.name: Clash of History: Witch Trials
89836.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the Middle Ages, a witch panic swept Europe, holding many nations in its thrall for centuries. Men and women believed in divine magic without doubt, miracles given as a gift from on high. If these were real, then evil must have agents in the world as well. Agents known as Witches.

Between 1200 and 1792 AD, when the last witch was executed in Europe, conservative estimates place the number of executions at between 50 and 100,000.

Clash of History: Witch Trials, brings this time of panic into your historically-themed OGL fantasy games. Providing a new core class, the Witch, along with a new Prestige Class, the Inquisitor.

Clash of History: Witch Trials also gives a complete overview of the witch trial period, the most popular witch hunter manuals and ways to bring a witch hunt into your ongoing campaign.

Whether your players are the hunter or the hunted, whether your campaign is set in Europe or is straight from your imagination, Clash of History: Witch Trials is for you.

89837.name: Clash of Kings: Guilds and Money
89837.description:
From publisher blurb:

Clash of Kings: Guilds and Money is the third in Vigilance Press' line of OGL historical fantasy supplements. This book presents the Guildsman core class, a class specializing in a craft or mercantile trade. Secondly, Clash of Kings: Guilds and Money presents source material on the organization and formation of medieval guilds and their effect on town politics in the Middle Ages. Finally, a section on medieval money is presented, with medieval coinages with their values in pounds, shillings and pence detailed. This section also includes the prices for standard equipment for your OGL game converted into pounds and shillings.

89838.name: Clash of Kings: Nobility
89838.description:
From publisher blurb:

Clash of Kings: Nobility is the second in Vigilance Press' line of historical fantasy sourcebooks.
Clash of Kings: Nobility presents a new core class, the Courtier, along with information on titles of nobility present in medieval Europe.

89839.name: Richelieu's Guide to Daily Expenses
89839.description:
From Introduction:

This free supplement takes a quick look at daily costs of living, with specific reference to taverns and inns. Everything in this supplement is optional, there for the Gamemaster to use or ignore as he sees fit.

rpgitemversion: Wild World Wrestling: Estrellas del Cuadrilátero PDF
89840.name: Wild World Wrestling
89840.description:
From publisher blurb:

Evolving from the cult-hit wrestling RPG licensed from the most recognizable brand in sports entertainment, Wild World Wrestling features an improved and streamlined system to replicate the frantic action, flashy cast, and flamboyant drama of professional wrestling!

Wild World Wrestling lays the smackdown like this:


No character classes. Make a wrestler however you want with your choice of Gimmick Enhancements
Critically acclaimed easy and versatile maneuver creation system to emulate, customize, and attempt any wrestling move on the go, without having to check pages of tables or be limited to a rigid moveset
Star Power to push a newcomer to the moon, re-push a mainstay over the top, or de-push an old hand to mid-card hell
Character Flaws that an opponent can activate and swing the tide of a match
Ring Rust for wrestlers returning from a long layoff
No hit points, but suffering enough injuries will definitely impair your performance
Multi-character cooperative yet competitive style of play. Character options include managers, announcers, interviewers, referees, promotion officials, and even ardent fans
No GM necessary; just grab two characters and have a match alone if you want


Wild World Wrestling will test your ring prowess as well as creative acumen and showmanship. Come walk the aisle as Da Champ of the best promotion - yours - in the world!

89841.name: Pangenre RPG Core Rules (1st Edition)
89841.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Pangenre RPG Core Rules™ are the centerpiece of the Pangenre RPG System™, a true multi-genre role-playing game. If you are yearning for a system that feels more realistic than existing designs, yet is still as playable as the easiest in-depth RPG system, Pangenre is for you!

Pangenre is built from Open Game Content as defined in the Open Game License (OGL). This makes it easier for experienced players to assimilate sweeping changes to the character and combat systems. But Pangenre is not just another d20 clone or spin-off. It's a brand-new game system.

The Open Game "core mechanic" remains intact. Decide on your action, roll dice, add modifiers, and compare to the target DC. So if you know how to play Open Game rules, you're already halfway to learning Pangenre!

Improvements over Open Game Rules
Pangenre RPG has many enhancements to the Open Game rules, such as:

A brand-new character system completely replaces the Open Game concepts of levels and classes with skill-based mechanics. * Within skills, you can specialize in areas of knowledge or gain competencies in esoteric equipment with ease. Playable, pregenerated characters from different genres (modern, future, historical, and fantasy) show you how to craft characters.
Revised Ability scores that add new dimensions to characters such as Perception. Old geezers will no longer hear a pin drop by virtue of their high Wisdom.
Reducing the gaminess of other systems by eliminating hit points entirely. Instead, when you are struck by an attack, you make a wound check that is influenced by factors such as your overall strength and your armor. There is a limit to how many wounds you can take, and there is always the possibility that powerful blow can take down a mighty character. No more, "Have the high hit point warrior run through the minefield," cheese!
Replacing the attack-of-opportunity mechanic with a reaction rule that fits much better in scenarios where firearms, especially modern or futuristic firearms, are in play.
The relationship between weapons and armor is much more realistic. Rather than prevent you from being struck by attacks, armor mitigates damage.
Simple, yet realistic language rules that use standardized skill concepts, are very simple to use, and fit as easily with scenarios where literacy is rare as with modern scenarios where you can learn to type and to read Braille.




The Pangenre RPG Core Rules™ is a game system rulebook, not a campaign sourcebook. It does not include scenario or campaign materials. Pangenre, LLC has released such materials seperately. You can also adapt your own game ideas to Pangenre immediately.

89842.name: Pro-Pinball Trilogy
89842.description:
User Summary:

This compilation features 3 classic Pro-Pinball tables in one package.

89843.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 221 - Jan 1994)
rpgissuearticle: A Few Paragraphs From the Editor
Fred Astaire's Dreaded Tango of Doom vs. The Amazing Cha-Cha Machine #3
Pickering and the Arch of Time
This Isn't The Zine You're Looking For #30
89843.description: Alarums & Excursions is an APA containing articles and discussion on a wide variety of RPG-related topics.

89844.name: Qubed
89844.description:
User Summary:

This Atari-published release compiles three XBLA games from developer Q-Games: "Every Extend Extra Extreme", "Lumines" & "Rez", along with some bonus interview footage.

89845.name: Prime Directive Federation
89845.description:
From the back of the book:
"The Galactic Good Guys!"
Complete United Federation of Planets Sourcefile Including:
- HISTORY: From the first warp space flight through the General War
- PLANETS: Detailed surveys of over a dozen major worlds
- MILITARY: Organization of Star Fleet, the Marines, and other forces
- EVERYTHING: Culture, politics, law, mysteries, colonization, and more.

89846.name: Eets: Chowdown
89846.description:
An enhanced version of the PC release Eets.

It includes 120 new levels and an action game called Marsho Madness.

Source: Wikipedia, "Eets", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89847.name: The Tower of Druaga
89847.description:
The player assumes the role of the hero Gilgamesh, whose goal is to rescue the maiden Ki (カイ, Kai) from the demon Druaga. To do this, he must traverse through 60 floors of an immense tower. Gilgamesh comes equipped with a sword, which he can use to defeat monsters, and a shield, which can be used to block magical attacks. The monsters get progressively more difficult as the game progresses, beginning with simple slimes and culminating with Druaga himself. Each floor consists of a maze filled with monsters, and a randomly placed locked door leading to the next level. The player must navigate through the maze to find a randomly placed key that unlocks the door. In addition, each floor contains a hidden treasure, which appears once the player has performed a specific requirement. The player's starting position is also randomly determined; however, the hidden treasure always appears in the same position the player starts from when revealed. The mazes themselves are not random, but there are various predetermined patterns. Some of the treasures are merely helpful items, some are detrimental, and some are essential to completing the game including the Blue Crystal Rod, the game's most important item; without it, Druaga will not appear and the player will be forced to return to an earlier floor.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Tower of Druaga", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89848.description:
Alvin & Dexter – A Ticket to Ride Monster Expansion can be added to any of the various standalone Ticket to Ride games that designer Alan R. Moon and publisher Days of Wonder have released since 2004.

These monsters stymie players both during the game and once it ends. During play, no routes can be built into or out of a city where Alvin or Dexter are currently nesting, and during the final score tallying, any destination ticket showing a city where either monster stands is worth only half its normal value.

Desperately need to build a route to Seattle, Paris, or wherever else a roaming monster has set up shop? Discard one (or two) wild locomotive cards, and you can move the monster up to three (or six) cities away from its current location. Move a monster more than any other player, and you'll pick up an endgame bonus for your role as monster minder.
89848.name: Ticket to Ride: Alvin & Dexter
boardgamepodcastepisode: Spiele-Podcast Nr. 104: Alvin & Dexter - Eine Zug um Zug Monster-Erweiterung (Days of Wonder)

89849.name: Magic Darts
89849.description:
User Summary

A simple game of darts with a variety of characters (some with special abilities) for 1 - 4 players.

89850.name: Race America
89850.description:
The game involves driving on America's roads at approximately 200 miles (320 km) per hour from Boston to Los Angeles - a whopping 2,990 miles (4,810 km) from start to finish over a series of stages or legs. Each player must try to gain personal glory by competing against eight computer-controlled players who can race their way across the United States of America.

Source: Wikipedia, "Race America", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89851.description:
It's the story before "Quest: Zeit der Helden - Angriff der Orks". A small adventure (only 14 sections) to take the first time with the game.

One or two players take on the role of heroes while another player is their antagonist - the Questmaster. He controls all the challenges that the other players cooperatively have to master with the clever use of their skills and abilities.

Note: This is only a short quest, to show the object of the game.
89851.name: Quest: Zeit der Helden – Dein Weg ins Abenteuer

89852.name: Mappy
89852.description:
From the arcade flyer:

The Ultimate cat-and-mouse game.
There's a mouse in the house...and more than one crafty cat hot on his trail. Open the right doors and help flee the felines before the fur flies.

89853.name: Bosconian
89853.description:
Bosconian was a multi-directional shooter arcade game that was developed by Namco in 1981. It runs on Namco Galaga hardware but with a video system like that used in Rally-X.

The object of Bosconian is to score as many points as possible by destroying enemy bases and ships. The player controls a small fighter ship that can move in eight directions and can fire both forward and backward. Each level consists of a number of green space stations that must all be destroyed to advance to the next level (a semi-transparent mini-map helps identify their location). Each station consists of six cannons arranged in a hexagon, surrounding a central core. The player must either destroy all six cannons or shoot the core to destroy a station, and in later levels the core is capable of defending itself.

Additionally, the player must avoid or destroy asteroids, mines, and a variety of enemy missiles and ships that attempt to collide with the player's ship. Enemies occasionally launch formation attacks — destroying the leader causes all remaining enemies to disperse, but destroying all enemies in a formation scores extra bonus points. A spy ship (worth a random bonus value) also appears occasionally, which must be destroyed or the enemies will go berserk.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bosconian," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89854.name: The Laundry Gamemaster's Screen
89854.description:
Publisher blurb:

Packed with all the information a Gamemaster needs for easy reference during a session of The Laundry, this 'deluxe' thick screen will speed up your games and last for years.

89855.name: Airport Terminal
89855.description:
Meridian, who previously launched 3 classic Time Management titles, has brought you the brand new Airport Terminal. Being the first title in the genre to use airports as main theme, you will be able run ones from different countries, making sure everything flows as smoothly as possible.

Like most Time Management games, your objective is to satisfy your customers with fast and efficient service. From check-in to boarding, passengers will require a lot of attention from you. It's your job to make sure they pass through various stages without becoming stressed.

You will be able to take on the roles of ground staff checking in your passengers, a shopkeeper selling souvenirs, and even the custom officers who make sure that little girl with a pistol doesn't get on the flight.

One of the unique features in this new title is that game flow is divided into two parts: Check-in lobby and Restricted area. You will be able to play two distinctive scenes in each stage and follow the real procedure of boarding an aircraft.

Source: The Developer Website.

89856.name: The Hour Between Dog and Wolf (1km1kt)
rpg: The Hour Between Dog and Wolf
89856.description:
Publisher's Description:

In the years between 1764 and 1767, something killed over a hundred people in the Gevaudan region of southern France. Popular opinion was that it was a wolf, but survivors’ accounts suggest otherwise. Under considerable scrutiny from outside, King Louis XV mounted no fewer than three offensives aimed at delivering to him The Beast of Gevaudan. In his name, hundreds of wolves were slaughtered, but he never caught the real Beast. Perhaps he should have consulted with the wolves.

89857.name: Ye Little Book of HeroQuest Dungeoneering
89857.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the world of Old School done New School!

This 'Genre Pak' aims to emulate the feel and excitement of those early dungeon based adventures of the 70s/80s. It is designed so you can quickly and easily generate heroes, pick up the small amount of genre specific rules, and then head down the example dungeon. If you are looking to introduce your players to HeroQuest, in a setting that should be familiar and comfortable to all of them, this is

Ye Little Book of HeroQuest Dungeoneering is split into five sections.

1. Hero generation. Four class keywords and four racial keywords, with guidance on how to create old school heroes of Sword and Sorcery.

2. Magic. Gives Vancian Magic as a magic framework, with example spells and magic items.

3. Monsters. Guidance on how to convert your favourite old school monster to HeroQuest.

4. Dungeon Design. A frame work for quickly creating dungeon based adventures.

5. The Catacombs of Zaz. An example medium level dungeon.

89858.name: Power Drome
89858.description:
Power Drome is a futuristic racing game, similar to the F-Zero and Wipeout series. Players control vehicles called "blades" as they race around the track at very high speeds. If players run into other racers or into walls, their vehicle will take damage. If the player damages their vehicle too much, it will explode.

Source: User Summary

89859.name: Apathy: The Calling
89859.description:
From publisher blurb:

Apathy: The Calling is a lighthearted RPG in the vein of games such as Call of Cthulhu. The Player’s play everyday joes picked by Cthulhu and must deal with their increasingly weird world.

In this game you play regular folk dealing with the mythos in the only way they can in the modern age, with apathy. As one of the select few for unknown reasons you can hear Dread Cthulhu as he dreams, calling you to commit unspeakable acts. Fortunately you’ve long been accustomed to ignoring inconvenient realities. You fight back with the inertia and apathy, that has defined you as a generation of slackers, miscreants, good for nothings, baby busters and losers.

89860.name: Rath-Tha
89860.description:
User Summary

The space station Aspir-Hadora, galactic junk recycling plant, is threatened by Rath-tha, a giant mothership from the planet T'ufo. The invaders want to destroy the recycling plant, so that the whole galaxy fills with space garbage. Conventional weaponry is useless against Rath-tha, only professor Locaten's experimental spaceship (built according to ancient legends he heard on the planet Freak) has a chance against the invaders.

Rath-tha is a classic top-down shoot'em up. The player must battle against hordes of enemies across 4 stages while dodging enemy fire and ships. Destroyed enemies leave behind space junk that can be collected for various effects (energy boost, extra points, keys to pass through bareers).

89862.name: Atlantis
89862.description:
From publisher blurb:

Atlantis is a roleplaying game where you play the last inhabitants of the Isle of Atlantis during its last days. Atlantis is burning and at midnight will sink into the sea, forever. Attempt to flee Atlantis while facing your Hopes, deeds, fears, and dooms before midnight, when Atlantis sinks under the waves forever.

89863.name: Coronation Street Quest
89863.description: A trivia game based on the TV soap Coronation Street. Players move around the board answering questions on the programme, collecting the letters 'QUEST' from various destinations as they do so. There are also 'Cobble cards', which either help or hinder the player's progress.

89865.name: Enchanted
89865.description:
User Summary

In 1522 the wizard Darling foresaw the destruction of the Earth in the 21st century by the demon Willchungus. He summoned his travelling sphere and set out to defeat the demon, but Willchungus captured the sphere and teleported it inside a pinball machine. You're the pinball player and you must help Darling escape the machine.

Enchant is a pinball simulation game. Players must defeat each of the nine levels to be able to complete the game. Each level is a different layout and has a different objective to complete. Once the level is cleared, an opening appears on top of the screen leading on to the next level.

89866.name: Black Bag Jobs
89866.description:
Publisher blurb:

The Laundry – protecting the United Kingdom from the scum of the multiverse. Most of the time, saving the world is a 9 to 5 job. Clock in every morning. Feel your life tick away with each meeting and each pointless bit of paperwork. Stare at a screen and feel your brain leaking out through your ears. Try to keep the boredom from killing you. Clock out in the evening and slouch home.

It's never good when they call you into the office at four in the morning. Any mission that doesn't fit on the standard day planner is inevitably ghastly. They involve things with too many tentacles, people who want to kill you, and secrets that mean you'll never sleep well again. Keep your mouth shut and your head down, and you might just make it through the night. Screw up, and it's entirely possible you just doomed humanity to a fate worse than death.

No pressure.

Black Bag Jobs contains six self-contained missions for your Laundry campaign. From the war-torn hillsides of Afghanistan to the corridors of power in Whitehall, from yoga lessons in Devon to the end of the world, it's time to break in and steal the secrets of reality, like:


The truth about social networking
How to weaponize a shoggoth
Management secrets of the undying priests
What the Auditors fear
How to prepare for the apocalypse
... and what happens after.

89867.name: Tenra War (天羅WAR)
89867.description:
Source: Wikipedia Tenra War
available under the CC-BY-SA License.

The setting is based after the intercontinental war between two continents: Tenra (similar to a high-magic Japan in the Sengoku period) and Terra (similar to a United States in the Wild West). After the war, the world was changed by the influence of great culture clash between oriental and occidental nations. The game starts from that point, after the two cultures have had some time to intermingle. That's when the mysterious alien "Angels" arrive, great psychic/magical creatures with strange and unknowable motives. The basic setup of the game is two radical cultures joining together to fight off an alien invasion.
There are over 40 character classes based on oriental and western cultures in basic rulebook, which include houshi (buddhist monk), Jinguuke (Shinto's agent belonging to the Jinguuke clan), ninja, onmyouji, samurai, Yoroi-nori (mecha pilot), gunslinger, preacher and private eye, rocket ranger (member of US Army's special airborne forces) , saloon girl and steam mage. To emphasize the cultural mashup, classes are mixable: One could create a ninja gunfighter, a Taoist Sorcerer Catholic priest, a kugutsu (living doll) saloon girl, and so on. Oriental and western characters fight against the angels that are arch-foes of humankind together.

89868.name: The Laundry Files: Agent's Handbook
89868.description:
Publisher blurb:

The Laundry is the world’s only ISO9001-approved occult intelligence agency. As a Laundry officer, you're empowered and bound to investigate bizarre cults, thwart misguided experiments, exorcise demons from computer networks or the brains of voters, and ensure that the world doesn't get destroyed ahead of schedule... and come in under budget, or the Auditors will eat your soul.

You can't efficiently protect the United Kingdom from the scum of the multiverse (in an efficient, enterprise-focussed sustainable customer-facing manner) without this employee's handbook. Inside, you'll find:


Advice on tradecraft, tactics, and safe sorcery



New equipment and training courses



Things with tentacles, some of which may be your co-workers



Rules for civilians, external contractors and non-Laundry personnel



Archival notes on the Laundry, including rules for running historical games



Maddening forms and eldritch bureaucracy



And more!


The Laundry Files: Agent's Handbook – for those employees who, on the whole, would prefer not to be devoured by alien space gods. Everyone else, form an orderly queue for Cthulhu.

89869.name: Skip-Bo MOD
89869.description:
The popular card game gets a modern makeover with bold graphics and a sleek, portable case, making it a great gift idea! It's still the same classic game - but has been enhanced with an exclusive MOD die. For ages 7+.

--
