Together with Book 2: The Game Master’s Starter Guide, this is the playtester’s version of the Starter Kit for the Myth & Magic Fantasy Role Playing Game. This set of books includes many of the updates and revisions that were suggested by active participants in the open playtest over the past several months. It includes certain expansions that the developers also wished to make. It would be a fair characterization to view this kit as the beta version of the rules and, as the playtest continues, the rules are subject to change. As we have constantly reinforced this ideal in the past, Myth & Magic is very much a community game, and together we will continue to push the envelope to create the best game possible.

In the alpha release, now called the Classic Starter Kit, we presented a game that was, in many instances, an updated and streamlined version of the 2nd edition of the world’s most popular roleplaying game. The Classic Starter Kit was not intended to be the final product. It was intended to be the foundation upon which we build new and exciting game mechanics as a community. The rules are open content, so we were able to discuss the rules and revise them.

This revised Starter Kit incorporates some monumental changes. The first change (but certainly not the largest) took place in the combat mechanic. Armor Class is still ascending, but the base was changed to 10. The "To Hit" value was replaced by a Base to Hit bonus. These changes to the combat system bring the attack resolution system of Myth & Magic more in line with games like Castles & Crusades, the 3rd Edition and Pathfinder. The combat is still imaginative and no emphasis was placed on miniatures, movement or range to retain the tone of classic play.

We added a seventh attribute: Perception. For this, we thank Thomas Ruddick and the then editors of Dragon Magazine. In Issue #133 (May, 1988), Mr. Ruddick authored an article entitled, "Notice Anything Different", which allowed for the introduction of a seventh attribute to the Advanced Dungeons & Dragons™ roleplaying game. Since that May of 1988, no iteration of the world’s most popular role playing game included this seventh stat, although its inclusion was sensible and Mr. Ruddick’s article sold the attribute properly. Myth & Magic breaks this trend and it is a better game for it.

There are other changes, of course. We added classes, races, spells, proficiencies, equipment, rules and more!

The introduction of the BASE20 system to Myth & Magic is perhaps the largest change, though. It impacts the proficiency system dramatically and it creeps up in other aspects of the game. The BASE20 system is a ladder of complexity and it is used to quickly gauge the difficulty of a given task and the required roll to succeed. Almost all skill-based tasks use the ladder, so if you can remember the BASE20 system, you can easily master the entire non-combat system. It is a major streamline that makes playing and running the game much easier.

89964.name: Ocean Surprise
89964.description:
Components
Game Board with Rotating Centre
4 White Boats
12 Playing Pawns (3 each of 4 color)
1 Dice
Instructions Booklet.

Objective:
To race other players through the jungle and the rotating sea board and be the first to jump into the safety boats.

Players control 3 pawns that move on the roll of one d6. Players can choose what pawn to move. There are hazards applying to certain spaces that should try to avoid. Once the pawns reach the port they jump into the rotating boats and eventually will move to the other side of the river.

The first player to reach the end of the path with the 3 pawns is declared winner.

89965.name: Deep Strike
89965.description:
User Summary

Deep Strike is a light WWI combat flight simulation. The player pilots a biplane fighter escorting 4 bombers on a fuel depot bombing mission. The game uses a 3rd person view, the player's plane is displayed in the middle of the screen, with the four bombers in front. Enemy fighter can attack from all sides of the screen, and care must be taken not to accidentally hit one of the friendly planes. There is a set course to the bombers' target, and if the planes deviate too much from it they risk being shot down by anti-aircraft fire.

89966.description:
Have you ever wondered what happens underneath an evil counts magnificent and sprawling castle?

Welcome to the dank and stench-ridden basement of Count Hogarth's Castle, a large empty cellar which houses the Count's greatest secret, The Beast! A huge monstrosity held in its tomb only by the walls of the ancient cellar. Did it come from another world, the depths of the earth or is it the Counts long forgotten father? Either way the only thing keeping from breaking out and devouring the world is feeding it plenty of sewer Critters. And what unlucky fool gets this job you ask? Why you of course! One of the dozens of hapless servants that work under the Counts rule.

Feed the Beast is a simple and fast-paced dice game of gambling and luck. Players compete against each other to fumble in the sewers for Critters and then feed the gigantic Beast in a Medieval setting.

On a players turn they roll dice to move, search for critters or feed the Beast. Play continues until one player manages to give the beast his fill of Critters, that player is then the winner!
89966.name: Feed the Beast

89967.name: Maxi Bourse
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
89967.description:
User Summary

Maxi Bourse is a faithful computer adaptation of the eponymous Schmidt France boardgame. Players compete to buy and sell stocks on the stock market, with the goal of either gaining control of a specific industry or build a powerful conglomerate.

The game can be played by up to 6 players, either humans or computer-controlled.

89968.name: I.Q. Final
89968.description:
User Summary

Sequel to Intelligent Qube, with similar gameplay. Only released in Japan and Europe.

European name is "Kurushi Final: Mental Blocks"

89969.name: I.Q. Remix+: Intelligent Qube
89969.description:
User Summary

The third game in the Intelligent Qube series. Released only in Japan.

This game is an update of the first game, but includes new graphics, new levels, and adds both competitive and co-op multiplayer.

89971.name: Spitfire 40
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
UK Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
89971.description:
User Summary

Spitfire 40 is a flight simulation set in WWII. As a young Spitfire pilot, you must fight German fighters during the battle of Britain. Successful missions earn you promotion and medals.

The game has 3 modes, Practice, Combat practice and Combat. In Combat mode, a briefing gives the player the number of enemies, their bearing and altitude and it's up to the player to take off, intercept the enemy and land safely on a R.A.F. base. The player's character can be saved to disk after each successful mission or training session.

The game was praised at its released for its simulation of flight dynamics. It was developed in collaboration with the Battle of Britain museum of Hendon, UK.

89972.description:
Steffen Bendorf, designer of the 2009 release Würfel Express, is back with another dicey design, this time from Schmidt Spiele as part of its new line of dice games

Each round in Fiese 15, a new target card is revealed showing six differently colored dice that sum to 15. On a turn, a player rolls all six dice, then sets aside any dice that have a value equal to or less than the similarly-colored die on the target card. For example, if the card has a blue die showing a 4, then any value from 1 to 4 on the blue die would be valid and set aside. The player can stop and score points equal to the sum of his valid dice or roll the invalid dice. If he rolls at least one valid die, he sets that aside and can choose to stop or roll again; if he rolls no valid dice, then he scores points equal to all the dice on the target card for which no die was set aside. Set aside five dice, and you score an extra five points; set aside all six, and your score for the round is doubled. Whoever has the most points after ten rounds wins the game.

Fiese 15 includes 15 target cards, with only ten being used each game. The target cards are double-sided, with only five dice showing on the opposite side, allowing players to choose a variant that handicaps the leaders with tougher targets.

89973.name: The Terran Trade Authority Roleplaying Game
rpg: The Terran Trade Authority Roleplaying Game
89973.description:
User Summary:

A role-playing game set in the Terran Trade Authority (TTA) universe created by Stewart Cowley in 1978, with the book Spacecraft 2000-2100 A.D.: Terran Trade Authority Handbook. The TTA series included other TTA books (Spacewreck, Starliners, Great Space Battles, Starbase 2000) and 6 unofficial TTA books Cowley published under the pseudonym Steven Caldwell. The books and setting were widely known for the great art which Cowley bundled together under the TTA brand from various pulp scifi magazine and book covers. The RPG builds on and expands on the universe Cowley created.

The TTA RPG uses the OMNI system mechanic, but is self contained and requires no other books to play.

89974.name: Spacecraft 2100 - 2200 AD
rpg: The Terran Trade Authority Roleplaying Game
89974.description:
User Summary:

An expansion book for The Terran Trade Authority RPG system which details new spacecraft.

It requires the TTA RPG core rulebook to play.

89975.name: Agoraphobia
89975.description: In Agoraphobia, players try to keep their pieces (agoraphobes) out of the crowd. Agoraphobia is an abstract strategy game for two players in which each player seeks to push their opponents pieces into large groups. Each turn, a player places one agoraphobe on a hexagonal grid. When it is places, each agoraphobe pushes all adjacent pieces away by either one or two spaces, depending on the size of the piece that was played. An agoraphobe may only be placed if it pushes at least one piece away, leaving it sufficient breathing room. The game ends when one player can not place any of their remaining pieces. The player who ends the game with the largest group of adjacent pieces is the loser.

89976.name: Bugs & Co
89976.description:
In this game, everyone plays at the same time, and players' speed and memory skills get a thorough workout!

A number of "monster" tiles are spread face down on the table. The aim of the game is to collect as many families of three identical monsters as possible, without being fooled by similar-looking impostors!

When the game starts, each player (using one hand only) must turn over and pick up as many "monster" tiles as possible, one by one. Each tile thus collected is placed face down in the player's other hand. Once a player has placed a tile in their second hand, they cannot look at it again or put it back on the table. Any mistakes will cost you dearly, with penalty points at the end of the game for incomplete and mismatched families.

A limited number of "trophy" tiles are laid out face up alongside the "monster" tiles. Bonus points are awarded for each "trophy" tile at the end of the game. At any time, a player can pick up the highest-value "trophy" tile still available and place it in their other hand. The player must then stop playing. When the last "trophy" tile is taken, all the players who have collected a "trophy" tile and stopped playing start calling out a ten-second countdown. The game ends when the countdown reaches zero and any players without a "trophy" tile must also stop playing.

89977.description:
Tiger Stripes is a quick and exciting game for 2-4 players ages 5 and up. Your tiger has no stripes! Earn them by hunting for food or searching for valuable jewels. Players do this by choosing either a "Hunt for Food" card or a "Search for Jewels" card. The "Hunt for Food" cards include various animals worth a number of stripes. Monkeys let you add one stripe to your tiger, snakes add two, deer add three and boars add four. However, this deck contains several "Give One Stripe to Any Tiger" cards, so don't push your luck too far.

On the other hand, players may choose a "Search for Jewels" card. These cards contain various numbers of jewels worth one point each. These add directly to your score. This deck also includes some "Take a Jewel Card from Another Tiger" cards.

When a tiger gains all ten of its stripes, the game is over. Players count up how many points they have from jewels, then subtract two points for each missing stripe. The player with the highest score wins. Tiger Stripes enhances basic math skills in a fun and engaging way.
89977.name: Tiger Stripes

89978.name: Richard Burns Rally
89978.description:
Richard Burns Rally (RBR) is a sim racing game, published by SCi and developed by Warthog with advice of WRC driver Richard Burns. It simulates both classic and modern rallying, and is best known for its realistic physics engine.

This game is considered by many gamers to be one of the most realistic and difficult racing simulators. RBR was not made to be modifiable, but despite this there are mods available due to a large online community. The game was originally an offline racing game but user created mods have enabled online play. A sequel to the game is unlikely, due to the death of Richard Burns in 2005. In addition, after the PC release, Warthog was sold to Gizmondo, who went bankrupt in 2006. Since the release, the publisher SCi Purchased Eidos Interactive in an all-share offer, winning a bidding war from then-former EA man John Riccitiello and Eidos management.

Source: Wikipedia, "Richard Burns Rally", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89979.name: The Spaceship Graveyard
89979.description:
"The Spaceship Graveyard" is a BBC Books adventure book written by Colin Brake and based on the long-running British science fiction television series Doctor Who. It features the Tenth Doctor and Martha.

This is part of the Decide Your Destiny series which makes you choose what happens in the books.

Source: Wikipedia The Spaceship Graveyard
available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89980.name: Alien Arena
89980.description:
"Alien Arena" is a BBC Books adventure book written by Richard Dungworth and is based on the long-running British science fiction television series Doctor Who. It features the Tenth Doctor and Martha.

This is part of the Decide Your Destiny series which makes you choose what happens in the books.

Source: Wikipedia Alien Arena
available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89981.name: The Time Crocodile
89981.description:

This is part of the Decide Your Destiny series which makes you choose what happens in the books.

Source: Wikipedia The Time Crocodile
available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89982.name: The Corinthian Project
89982.description:

This is part of the Decide Your Destiny series which makes you choose what happens in the books.

Source: Wikipedia The Corinthian Project
available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89983.name: The Crystal Snare
89983.description:
"The Crystal Snare" is a BBC Books adventure book written by Richard Dungworth and is based on the long-running British science fiction television series Doctor Who. It features the Tenth Doctor and Martha.

This is part of the Decide Your Destiny series which makes you choose what happens in the books.

Source: Wikipedia The Crystal Snare
available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89984.name: War of the Robots
89984.description:
"War of the Robots" is a BBC Books adventure book written by Trevor Baxendale and is based on the long-running British science fiction television series Doctor Who. It features the Tenth Doctor and Martha.

This is part of the Decide Your Destiny series which makes you choose what happens in the books.

On a distant world populated by robots, war has been raging for many years. Can you, the Doctor and Martha discover why the robots are fighting and end the war once and for all?

Source: Wikipedia War of the Robots
available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89985.name: NBA Inside Drive 2000
89985.description:
From the back of the box:

NBA Inside Drive is the most intense and exciting basketball you've ever played on a PC. You'll find all the speed, power, and energy of the NBA - but with one major difference: you're no longer a mere spectator.

89986.name: Claws of the Macra
89986.description:
publisher blurb

Join the Eleventh Doctor and Amy on their travels through time and space and influence the story with your decisions. Choose a direction and let the adventures begin...

Danger and adventure await you on a school trip to gas refinery infested by giant alien crystaceans!

89987.name: The Coldest War
89987.description:
publisher blurb

Join the Eleventh Doctor and Amy on their travels through time and space and influence the story with your decisions. Choose a direction and let the adventures begin...

You're in the TARDIS when it crash lands. Something is sucking the energy from everything it passes. Is it the Sycorax?

89988.name: Judoon Monsoon
89988.description:
publisher blurb

Join the Eleventh Doctor and Amy on their travels through time and space and influence the story with your decisions. Choose a direction and let the adventures begin...

Bo-ro-lo-ko-sho! Giant alien insectoids are terrorising the rainy planet Betul - and the menacing Judoon are wreaking havoc, too!

89989.name: Empire of the Wolf
89989.description:
publisher blurb

Join the Eleventh Doctor and Amy on their travels through time and space and influence the story with your decisions. Choose a direction and let the adventures begin...

There’s a full moon rising and an ancient evil roams the streets. The Empire of the Wolf has begun!

89990.name: Dark Planet
89990.description:
"Dark Planet" is a BBC Books adventure book written by Davey Moore and is based on the long-running British science fiction television series Doctor Who. It features the Tenth Doctor and Martha.

This is part of the Decide Your Destiny series which makes you choose what happens in the books.

Source: Wikipedia Dark Planet
available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89991.name: The Haunted Wagon Train
89991.description:
"The Haunted Wagon Train" is a BBC Books adventure book written by Colin Brake and is based on the long-running British science fiction television series Doctor Who. It features the Tenth Doctor and Martha.

This is part of the Decide Your Destiny series which makes you choose what happens in the books.

Pioneers travelling across the American mid-West report ghost sightings, but you, the Doctor and Martha believe it's extra-terrestrial activity. Can you track down the aliens before it's too late?

Source: Wikipedia The Haunted Wagon Train
available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89992.name: Lost Luggage
89992.description:
"Lost Luggage" is a BBC Books story adventure book written by Colin Brake and based on the long-running British science fiction television series Doctor Who. It features the Tenth Doctor.

This is part of the Decide Your Destiny series which makes you choose what happens in the books.

When the TARDIS goes missing in a busy spaceport, the Doctor and you must race against time and across space to find it, before the Doctor's incredible spaceship is lost forever.

Source: Wikipedia Lost Luggage
available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89993.name: Second Skin
89993.description:
"Second Skin" is a BBC Books story adventure book written by Richard Dungworth and based on the long-running British science fiction television series Doctor Who. It features the Tenth Doctor.

This is part of the Decide Your Destiny series which makes you choose what happens in the books.

When you find yourself on a twenty-third century space station, you soon realise a dangerous alien parasite has taken over most of the people on-board. Can you and the Doctor destroy it before it reaches Earth?

Source: Wikipedia Second Skin
available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89994.name: The Dragon King
89994.description:
"The Dragon King" is a BBC Books story adventure book written by Trevor Baxendale and based on the long-running British science fiction television series Doctor Who. It features the Tenth Doctor.

This is part of the Decide Your Destiny series which makes you choose what happens in the books.

Your journey takes you to the planet Elanden, where people live side by side with dragons. But hunters from a neighbouring planet are attacking... Can you restore peace to these two clashing worlds?

Source: Wikipedia The Dragon King
available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89995.name: The Horror of Howling Hill
89995.description:
"The Horror of Howling Hill" is a BBC Books adventure book written by Jonathan Green and based on the long-running British science fiction television series Doctor Who. It features the Tenth Doctor and Martha.

This is part of the Decide Your Destiny series which makes the reader choose what happens.

Source: Wikipedia From Wikipedia
available under the CC-BY-SA License.

89996.description:
From the publisher's website:

MBI won’t let their mistakes haunt them any longer. They know their nuke will wipe out all traces of their crimes when the Countdown ends, but what of the small chance that a survivor escapes with the Hermit and his Intel?

Enter the MBI Black Ops squad, a team of 5 deadly Soldiers under the command of the ruthless Chrissy. Will they pick off any lucky survivors before the Countdown wipes out the rest of them? Or will they fall victim to the heroes much like the horde of Undead surrounding them all?

Introducing a new playable character, CHRISSY: the fair-haired Controller of the Black Ops squad. Ant was once his greatest student until Chrissy's thirst for innocent blood turned the young soldier against his team and into a life of isolation. Now armed with an even deadlier group of 5 Black Ops Soldiers, Chrissy has been sent into the heart of Zombie-infested Endicott with a simple mission from the heads of MBI: kill everyone and everything before it can escape the end of the Nuclear Countdown.

Hidden within the play deck amongst the flesh-craving Undead are the five Black Ops Soldiers. Uncover one, and become marked for execution. Try to fend off the Soldier with all your might until the sneaky assassins slither back into hiding within the remainder of the deck. Beware, once you are marked you run the risk of being executed sooner than you think! Take a breather from combating the Undead in order to attempt to remove the marks; but don't spend too much time to yourself - every attempt to remove a mark, whether successful or not, will cost you some of your slain Zombies.

When the time comes, Chrissy will send out the command to his Soldiers to EXECUTE! Roll the die when the command is drawn; the matching marks are instantly executed and players take damage (potentially fatal, if you have a hard time removing your marks). But that's not all - sometimes the Execute commands will allow more than one Soldier to execute their marks, spelling certain doom for any players who have unwillingly collected a variety of marks from several different Soldiers. If you fall victim to one of the Soldiers, respawning is no longer an option. You are instantly killed and any Cure cards you were holding become compromised with the Solders' evil decoy-deception. Now your allies must roll a successful Cure Retrieval value TWICE before they can take the Cure card and win the game.

Despite their advantages in both stealth and strength, the Black Ops Soldiers are still only human. If you can manage to do so, killing one will reward you dearly - not in points and not in monetary value, but with the knowledge that you and your comrades can walk the desolate streets of an apocalyptic Endicott with a bit more safety. But beware - the Zombies still run amok, and they LOVE adrenaline-pumped prey!

Contents:

18 Game Cards
88 5/8" Chits
7 Game Mats
1 Full Color 2-sided rules sheet

The Penguin and the Red Triangle Circus Gang have Gotham City in a death grip! Look Out! Catwoman prowls the streets. It's time to duke it out with Gotham's notorious hoodlums. Just like the hit movie...

User Summary:

This is an official Living Forgotten Realms module, publically released by WoTC.


From the Title Page:

For decades, knights-errant of Cormyr have sought glory in the untamed Stonelands. It is common for these knights to bring a retinue of adventurers on such quests, and what better way to make a name for oneself? A Living Forgotten Realms adventure for characters levels 1-4.

90000.description:
User Summary:

A Living Forgotten Realms module, publically released by WoTc.


From the Title Page:

A killer stalks the night in the port city of Marsember, hunting down those with ties to the Haldoneir family, while the Agony drug continues to be a blight on Cormyrian society. Can the PCs figure out the killer’s motive and stop them before the situation worsens? A Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in Cormyr for characters levels 11-14. Part of the Pain and Suffering major quest, which starts/continues in DRAG2-1 Discomfort (level 11-14) and concludes in DALE2-2 Agony (level 14-17).
